XXXVII_NNP ._. Oriental_NNP Religions_NNP in_IN the_DT West_NNP

THE_DT WORSHIP_NN of_IN the_DT Great_NNP Mother_NNP of_IN the_DT Gods_NNP and_CC her_PRP$ lover_NN or_CC son_NN was_VBD
very_RB popular_JJ under_IN the_DT Roman_NNP Empire_NNP ._. Inscriptions_NNS prove_VBP that_IN the_DT two_CD
received_VBN divine_JJ honours_NNS ,_, separately_RB or_CC conjointly_RB ,_, not_RB only_RB in_IN
Italy_NNP ,_, and_CC especially_RB at_IN Rome_NNP ,_, but_CC also_RB in_IN the_DT provinces_NNS ,_,
particularly_RB in_IN Africa_NNP ,_, Spain_NNP ,_, Portugal_NNP ,_, France_NNP ,_, Germany_NNP ,_, and_CC
Bulgaria_NNP ._. Their_PRP$ worship_NN survived_VBD the_DT establishment_NN of_IN Christianity_NNP
by_IN Constantine_NNP ;_: for_IN Symmachus_NNP records_NNS the_DT recurrence_NN of_IN the_DT festival_NN
of_IN the_DT Great_NNP Mother_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT days_NNS of_IN Augustine_NNP her_PRP effeminate_NN
priests_NNS still_RB paraded_VBD the_DT streets_NNS and_CC squares_NNS of_IN Carthage_NNP with_IN
whitened_JJ faces_NNS ,_, scented_VBN hair_NN ,_, and_CC mincing_NN gait_NN ,_, while_IN ,_, like_IN the_DT
mendicant_JJ friars_NNS of_IN the_DT Middle_NNP Ages_NNPS ,_, they_PRP begged_VBD alms_RB from_IN the_DT
passers-by_NN ._. In_IN Greece_NNP ,_, on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, the_DT bloody_JJ orgies_NNS of_IN the_DT
Asiatic_JJ goddess_NN and_CC her_PRP$ consort_NN appear_VB to_TO have_VB found_VBN little_JJ favour_NN ._.
The_DT barbarous_JJ and_CC cruel_JJ character_NN of_IN the_DT worship_NN ,_, with_IN its_PRP$ frantic_JJ
excesses_NNS ,_, was_VBD doubtless_RB repugnant_JJ to_TO the_DT good_JJ taste_NN and_CC humanity_NN of_IN
the_DT Greeks_NNP ,_, who_WP seem_VBP to_TO have_VB preferred_VBN the_DT kindred_JJ but_CC gentler_JJR rites_NNS
of_IN Adonis_NNP ._. Yet_RB the_DT same_JJ features_NNS which_WDT shocked_VBD and_CC repelled_VBD the_DT
Greeks_NNS may_MD have_VB positively_RB attracted_VBN the_DT less_JJR refined_JJ Romans_NNS and_CC
barbarians_NNS of_IN the_DT West_NNP ._. The_DT ecstatic_NN frenzies_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD mistaken_VBN
for_IN divine_JJ inspiration_NN ,_, the_DT mangling_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN ,_, the_DT theory_NN of_IN a_DT
new_JJ birth_NN and_CC the_DT remission_NN of_IN sins_NNS through_IN the_DT shedding_NN of_IN blood_NN ,_,
have_VBP all_DT their_PRP$ origin_NN in_IN savagery_NN ,_, and_CC they_PRP naturally_RB appealed_VBD to_TO
peoples_NNS in_IN whom_WP the_DT savage_JJ instincts_NNS were_VBD still_RB strong_JJ ._. Their_PRP$ true_JJ
character_NN was_VBD indeed_RB often_RB disguised_VBN under_IN a_DT decent_JJ veil_NN of_IN
allegorical_JJ or_CC philosophical_JJ interpretation_NN ,_, which_WDT probably_RB sufficed_VBN
to_TO impose_VB upon_IN the_DT rapt_JJ and_CC enthusiastic_JJ worshippers_NNS ,_, reconciling_VBG
even_RB the_DT more_JJR cultivated_JJ of_IN them_PRP to_TO things_NNS which_WDT otherwise_RB must_MD have_VB
filled_VBN them_PRP with_IN horror_NN and_CC disgust_NN ._.

The_DT religion_NN of_IN the_DT Great_NNP Mother_NNP ,_, with_IN its_PRP$ curious_JJ blending_NN of_IN crude_NN
savagery_JJ with_IN spiritual_JJ aspirations_NNS ,_, was_VBD only_RB one_CD of_IN a_DT multitude_NN of_IN
similar_JJ Oriental_NNP faiths_NNS which_WDT in_IN the_DT later_JJ days_NNS of_IN paganism_NN spread_NN
over_IN the_DT Roman_NNP Empire_NNP ,_, and_CC by_IN saturating_VBG the_DT European_JJ peoples_NNS with_IN
alien_JJ ideals_NNS of_IN life_NN gradually_RB undermined_VBD the_DT whole_JJ fabric_NN of_IN
ancient_JJ civilisation_NN ._. Greek_NNP and_CC Roman_NNP society_NN was_VBD built_VBN on_IN the_DT
conception_NN of_IN the_DT subordination_NN of_IN the_DT individual_NN to_TO the_DT community_NN ,_,
of_IN the_DT citizen_NN to_TO the_DT state_NN ;_: it_PRP set_VBD the_DT safety_NN of_IN the_DT commonwealth_NN ,_,
as_IN the_DT supreme_JJ aim_NN of_IN conduct_NN ,_, above_IN the_DT safety_NN of_IN the_DT individual_NN

What_WP considerations_NNS led_VBD the_DT ecclesiastical_JJ authorities_NNS to_TO institute_VB

the_DT new_JJ deity_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ cardinal_JJ point_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ._. Only_RB it_PRP is_VBZ to_TO

twenty-fifth_JJ of_IN March_NNP ,_, his_PRP$ resurrection_NN ,_, according_VBG to_TO Christian_NNP

is_VBZ just_RB two_CD days_NNS later_RB than_IN the_DT vernal_JJ equinox_NN of_IN the_DT Julian_NNP
calendar_NN and_CC the_DT resurrection_NN of_IN Attis_NNP ._. A_DT similar_JJ displacement_NN of_IN
two_CD days_NNS in_IN the_DT adjustment_NN of_IN Christian_NNP to_TO heathen_VB celebrations_NNS
occurs_VBZ in_IN the_DT festivals_NNS of_IN St_NNP ._. George_NNP and_CC the_DT Assumption_NN of_IN the_DT
Virgin_NNP ._. However_RB ,_, another_DT Christian_JJ tradition_NN ,_, followed_VBN by_IN Lactantius_NNP
and_CC perhaps_RB by_IN the_DT practice_NN of_IN the_DT Church_NNP in_IN Gaul_NNP ,_, placed_VBD the_DT death_NN
of_IN Christ_NNP on_IN the_DT twenty-third_JJ and_CC his_PRP$ resurrection_NN on_IN the_DT
twenty-fifth_JJ of_IN March_NNP ._. If_IN that_WDT was_VBD so_RB ,_, his_PRP$ resurrection_NN coincided_VBN
exactly_RB with_IN the_DT resurrection_NN of_IN Attis_NNP ._.

In_IN point_NN of_IN fact_NN it_PRP appears_VBZ from_IN the_DT testimony_NN of_IN an_DT anonymous_JJ
Christian_NNP ,_, who_WP wrote_VBD in_IN the_DT fourth_JJ century_NN of_IN our_PRP$ era_NN ,_, that_WDT

contending_VBG that_IN the_DT resurrection_NN of_IN Christ_NNP was_VBD a_DT spurious_JJ imitation_NN
of_IN the_DT resurrection_NN of_IN Attis_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT Christians_NNPS asserting_VBG with_IN

inverting_VBG the_DT usual_JJ order_NN of_IN nature_NN ._.

Taken_VBN altogether_RB ,_, the_DT coincidences_NNS of_IN the_DT Christian_NNP with_IN the_DT heathen_NN

compelled_VBN to_TO make_VB with_IN its_PRP$ vanquished_JJ yet_CC still_RB dangerous_JJ rivals_NNS ._.
The_DT inflexible_JJ Protestantism_NNP of_IN the_DT primitive_JJ missionaries_NNS ,_, with_IN
their_PRP$ fiery_JJ denunciations_NNS of_IN heathendom_NN ,_, had_VBD been_VBN exchanged_VBN for_IN the_DT

their_PRP$ souls_NNS with_IN the_DT certainty_NN of_IN extinguishing_VBG the_DT species_NNS ._.



XXXVIII_NNP ._. The_DT Myth_NNP of_IN Osiris_NNP

IN_IN ANCIENT_NNP EGYPT_NNP the_DT god_NN whose_WP$ death_NN and_CC resurrection_NN were_VBD annually_RB
celebrated_VBN with_IN alternate_JJ sorrow_NN and_CC joy_NN was_VBD Osiris_NNP ,_, the_DT most_RBS
popular_JJ of_IN all_DT Egyptian_JJ deities_NNS ;_: and_CC there_EX are_VBP good_JJ grounds_NNS for_IN
classing_VBG him_PRP in_IN one_CD of_IN his_PRP$ aspects_NNS with_IN Adonis_NNP and_CC Attis_NNP as_IN a_DT
personification_NN of_IN the_DT great_JJ yearly_JJ vicissitudes_NNS of_IN nature_NN ,_,
especially_RB of_IN the_DT corn_NN ._. But_CC the_DT immense_JJ vogue_NN which_WDT he_PRP enjoyed_VBD for_IN
many_JJ ages_NNS induced_VBD his_PRP$ devoted_JJ worshippers_NNS to_TO heap_NN upon_IN him_PRP the_DT
attributes_NNS and_CC powers_NNS of_IN many_JJ other_JJ gods_NNS ;_: so_RB that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB always_RB
easy_JJ to_TO strip_VB him_PRP ,_, so_RB to_TO say_VB ,_, of_IN his_PRP$ borrowed_VBN plumes_NNS and_CC to_TO restore_VB
them_PRP to_TO their_PRP$ proper_JJ owners_NNS ._.

The_DT story_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP is_VBZ told_VBN in_IN a_DT connected_VBN form_NN only_RB by_IN Plutarch_NNP ,_,
whose_WP$ narrative_NN has_VBZ been_VBN confirmed_VBN and_CC to_TO some_DT extent_NN amplified_VBN in_IN
modern_JJ times_NNS by_IN the_DT evidence_NN of_IN the_DT monuments_NNS ._.

Osiris_NNP was_VBD the_DT offspring_NN of_IN an_DT intrigue_NN between_IN the_DT earth-god_NN Seb_NN
(_-LRB- Keb_NNP or_CC Geb_NNP ,_, as_IN the_DT name_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB transliterated_VBN )_-RRB- and_CC the_DT
sky-goddess_NN Nut_NNP ._. The_DT Greeks_NNP identified_VBD his_PRP$ parents_NNS with_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ
deities_NNS Cronus_NNP and_CC Rhea_NNP ._. When_WRB the_DT sun-god_NN Ra_NNP perceived_VBD that_IN his_PRP$ wife_NN
Nut_NNP had_VBD been_VBN unfaithful_JJ to_TO him_PRP ,_, he_PRP declared_VBD with_IN a_DT curse_NN that_IN she_PRP
should_MD be_VB delivered_VBN of_IN the_DT child_NN in_IN no_DT month_NN and_CC no_DT year_NN ._. But_CC the_DT
goddess_NN had_VBD another_DT lover_NN ,_, the_DT god_NN Thoth_NNP or_CC Hermes_NNP ,_, as_IN the_DT Greeks_NNS
called_VBN him_PRP ,_, and_CC he_PRP playing_VBG at_IN draughts_NNS with_IN the_DT moon_NN won_VBN from_IN her_PRP a_DT

hundred_CD and_CC sixty_CD days_NNS ._. This_DT was_VBD the_DT mythical_JJ origin_NN of_IN the_DT five_CD

of_IN every_DT year_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO establish_VB a_DT harmony_NN between_IN lunar_NN and_CC
solar_JJ time_NN ._. On_IN these_DT five_CD days_NNS ,_, regarded_VBN as_IN outside_IN the_DT year_NN of_IN
twelve_CD months_NNS ,_, the_DT curse_NN of_IN the_DT sun-god_NN did_VBD not_RB rest_NN ,_, and_CC
accordingly_RB Osiris_NNP was_VBD born_VBN on_IN the_DT first_JJ of_IN them_PRP ._. At_IN his_PRP$ nativity_NN a_DT
voice_NN rang_VBD out_RP proclaiming_VBG that_IN the_DT Lord_NN of_IN All_DT had_VBD come_VBN into_IN the_DT
world_NN ._. Some_DT say_VBP that_IN a_DT certain_JJ Pamyles_NNP heard_VBD a_DT voice_NN from_IN the_DT temple_NN
at_IN Thebes_DT bidding_VBG him_PRP announce_VB with_IN a_DT shout_NN that_IN a_DT great_JJ king_NN ,_, the_DT
beneficent_JJ Osiris_NNP ,_, was_VBD born_VBN ._. But_CC Osiris_NNP was_VBD not_RB the_DT only_JJ child_NN of_IN
his_PRP$ mother_NN ._. On_IN the_DT second_NN of_IN the_DT supplementary_JJ days_NNS she_PRP gave_VBD birth_NN

called_VBN Typhon_NNP ,_, on_IN the_DT fourth_JJ to_TO the_DT goddess_JJ Isis_NNP ,_, and_CC on_IN the_DT fifth_JJ
to_TO the_DT goddess_JJ Nephthys_NNP ._. Afterwards_RB Set_VB married_VBN his_PRP$ sister_NN Nephthys_NNP ,_,
and_CC Osiris_NNP married_VBD his_PRP$ sister_NN Isis_NNP ._.

Reigning_VBG as_IN a_DT king_NN on_IN earth_NN ,_, Osiris_NNP reclaimed_VBD the_DT Egyptians_NNS from_IN
savagery_NN ,_, gave_VBD them_PRP laws_NNS ,_, and_CC taught_VBD them_PRP to_TO worship_VB the_DT gods_NNS ._.
Before_IN his_PRP$ time_NN the_DT Egyptians_NNS had_VBD been_VBN cannibals_NNS ._. But_CC Isis_NNP ,_, the_DT
sister_NN and_CC wife_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP ,_, discovered_VBN wheat_NN and_CC barley_NN growing_VBG wild_JJ ,_,
and_CC Osiris_NNP introduced_VBD the_DT cultivation_NN of_IN these_DT grains_NNS amongst_IN his_PRP$
people_NNS ,_, who_WP forthwith_IN abandoned_VBN cannibalism_NN and_CC took_VBD kindly_RB to_TO a_DT
corn_NN diet_NN ._. Moreover_RB ,_, Osiris_NNP is_VBZ said_VBN to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT first_JJ to_TO gather_VB

he_PRP taught_VBD the_DT inhabitants_NNS to_TO console_VB themselves_PRP for_IN the_DT want_NN of_IN wine_NN

account_NN of_IN the_DT benefits_NNS he_PRP had_VBD conferred_VBN on_IN mankind_NN he_PRP was_VBD

(_-LRB- whom_WP the_DT Greeks_NNP called_VBD Typhon_NNP )_-RRB- with_IN seventy-two_CD others_NNS plotted_.
against_IN him_PRP ._. Having_VBG taken_VBN the_DT measure_NN of_IN his_PRP$ good_JJ brother_NN '_'' s_VBZ body_NN by_IN

after_IN the_DT other_JJ ,_, but_CC it_PRP fitted_VBD none_NN of_IN them_PRP ._. Last_NNP of_IN all_DT Osiris_NNP
stepped_VBD into_IN it_PRP and_CC lay_VBD down_RB ._. On_IN that_IN the_DT conspirators_NNS ran_VBD and_CC
slammed_VBD the_DT lid_NN down_IN on_IN him_PRP ,_, nailed_VBD it_PRP fast_RB ,_, soldered_VBD it_PRP with_IN molten_NN
lead_NN ,_, and_CC flung_VBD the_DT coffer_NN into_IN the_DT Nile_NNP ._. This_DT happened_VBD on_IN the_DT
seventeenth_JJ day_NN of_IN the_DT month_NN Athyr_NNP ,_, when_WRB the_DT sun_NN is_VBZ in_IN the_DT sign_NN of_IN
the_DT Scorpion_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN the_DT eight-and_CD -_: twentieth_JJ year_NN of_IN the_DT reign_NN or_CC
the_DT life_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP ._. When_WRB Isis_NNP heard_VBD of_IN it_PRP she_PRP sheared_VBD off_RP a_DT lock_NN of_IN
her_PRP$ hair_NN ,_, put_VBD on_IN a_DT mourning_VBG attire_NN ,_, and_CC wandered_VBD disconsolately_RB up_IN
and_CC down_RB ,_, seeking_VBG the_DT body_NN ._.

By_IN the_DT advice_NN of_IN the_DT god_NN of_IN wisdom_NN she_PRP took_VBD refuge_NN in_IN the_DT papyrus_NN
swamps_NNS of_IN the_DT Delta_NNP ._. Seven_CD scorpions_NNS accompanied_VBD her_PRP in_IN her_PRP$ flight_NN ._.
One_CD evening_NN when_WRB she_PRP was_VBD weary_JJ she_PRP came_VBD to_TO the_DT house_NN of_IN a_DT woman_NN ,_,
who_WP ,_, alarmed_VBN at_IN the_DT sight_NN of_IN the_DT scorpions_NNS ,_, shut_VBD the_DT door_NN in_IN her_PRP$

from_IN the_DT wrath_NN of_IN his_PRP$ wicked_JJ uncle_NN Set_VB ._. Yet_CC she_PRP could_MD not_RB guard_VB him_PRP
from_IN all_DT mishap_NN ;_: for_IN one_CD day_NN when_WRB Isis_NNP came_VBD to_TO her_PRP$ little_JJ son_NN '_'' s_PRP

for_IN help_NN ._. The_DT god_NN hearkened_VBD to_TO her_PRP and_CC staid_VBD his_PRP$ bark_NN in_IN the_DT sky_NN ,_,
and_CC sent_VBD down_RP Thoth_NNP to_TO teach_VB her_PRP the_DT spell_NN by_IN which_WDT she_PRP might_MD
restore_VB her_PRP$ son_NN to_TO life_NN ._. She_PRP uttered_VBD the_DT words_NNS of_IN power_NN ,_, and_CC
straightway_RB the_DT poison_NN flowed_VBD from_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN Horus_NNP ,_, air_NN passed_VBN
into_IN him_PRP ,_, and_CC he_PRP lived_VBD ._. Then_RB Thoth_NNP ascended_VBD up_RP into_IN the_DT sky_NN and_CC took_VBD
his_PRP$ place_NN once_RB more_RBR in_IN the_DT bark_NN of_IN the_DT sun_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT bright_JJ pomp_NN
passed_VBN onward_RB jubilant_JJ ._.

the_DT river_NN and_CC away_RB out_IN to_TO sea_NN ,_, till_IN at_IN last_JJ it_PRP drifted_VBD ashore_RB at_IN

suddenly_RB and_CC enclosed_VBD the_DT chest_NN in_IN its_PRP$ trunk_NN ._. The_DT king_NN of_IN the_DT

into_IN a_DT pillar_NN of_IN his_PRP$ house_NN ;_: but_CC he_PRP did_VBD not_RB know_VB that_IN the_DT coffer_NN with_IN
the_DT dead_JJ Osiris_NNP was_VBD in_IN it_PRP ._. Word_NNP of_IN this_DT came_VBD to_TO Isis_NNP and_CC she_PRP
journeyed_VBN to_TO Byblus_NNP ,_, and_CC sat_VBD down_RB by_IN the_DT well_NN ,_, in_IN humble_JJ guise_NN ,_, her_PRP$
face_NN wet_JJ with_IN tears_NNS ._. To_TO none_NN would_MD she_PRP speak_VB till_IN the_DT king_NN '_POS s_PRP
handmaidens_NNS came_VBD ,_, and_CC them_PRP she_PRP greeted_VBD kindly_RB ,_, and_CC braided_VBD their_PRP$

the_DT stranger_NN woman_NN and_CC took_VBD her_PRP into_IN her_PRP$ house_NN and_CC made_VBD her_PRP the_DT
nurse_NN of_IN her_PRP$ child_NN ._. But_CC Isis_NNP gave_VBD the_DT babe_NN her_PRP finger_NN instead_RB of_IN her_PRP$

Such_JJ is_VBZ the_DT myth_NN or_CC legend_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP ,_, as_IN told_VBN by_IN Greek_NNP writers_NNS and_CC

._. ._. ._. I_PRP see_VBP thee_PRP not_RB ,_, yet_RB doth_VBP my_PRP$ heart_NN yearn_NN after_IN thee_PRP and_CC mine_NN

The_DT lamentations_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD sad_JJ sisters_NNS were_VBD not_RB in_IN vain_JJ ._. In_IN pity_NN

In_IN the_DT resurrection_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP the_DT Egyptians_NNPS saw_VBD the_DT pledge_NN of_IN a_DT life_NN

so_IN all_DT men_NNS hoped_VBD to_TO arise_VB like_IN him_PRP from_IN death_NN to_TO life_NN eternal_JJ ._.

Thus_RB according_VBG to_TO what_WP seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT general_JJ native_NN
tradition_NN Osiris_NNP was_VBD a_DT good_JJ and_CC beloved_JJ king_NN of_IN Egypt_NNP ,_, who_WP suffered_VBD
a_DT violent_JJ death_NN but_CC rose_VBD from_IN the_DT dead_JJ and_CC was_VBD henceforth_RB worshipped_VBN
as_IN a_DT deity_NN ._. In_IN harmony_NN with_IN this_DT tradition_NN he_PRP was_VBD regularly_RB

dead_JJ king_NN ,_, swathed_VBN in_IN the_DT wrappings_NNS of_IN a_DT mummy_NN ,_, but_CC wearing_VBG on_IN his_PRP$

his_PRP$ head_NN ._. Encircled_VBN by_IN the_DT nimbus_NN of_IN the_DT dead_NN yet_RB living_VBG god_NN ,_,

Kingdom_NNP the_DT holiest_JJS spot_NN in_IN Egypt_NNP ;_: his_PRP$ tomb_NN there_RB would_MD seem_VB to_TO have_VB
been_VBN to_TO the_DT Egyptians_NNPS what_WP the_DT Church_NNP of_IN the_DT Holy_NNP Sepulchre_NNP at_IN
Jerusalem_NNP is_VBZ to_TO Christians_NNS ._. It_PRP was_VBD the_DT wish_NN of_IN every_DT pious_JJ man_NN that_WDT
his_PRP$ dead_JJ body_NN should_MD rest_VB in_IN hallowed_JJ earth_NN near_IN the_DT grave_NN of_IN the_DT
glorified_VBN Osiris_NNP ._. Few_JJ indeed_RB were_VBD rich_JJ enough_RB to_TO enjoy_VB this_DT
inestimable_JJ privilege_NN ;_: for_IN ,_, apart_RB from_IN the_DT cost_NN of_IN a_DT tomb_NN in_IN the_DT
sacred_JJ city_NN ,_, the_DT mere_JJ transport_NN of_IN mummies_NNS from_IN great_JJ distances_NNS was_VBD
both_DT difficult_JJ and_CC expensive_JJ ._. Yet_CC so_RB eager_JJ were_VBD many_JJ to_TO absorb_VB in_IN
death_NN the_DT blessed_VBN influence_NN which_WDT radiated_VBD from_IN the_DT holy_JJ sepulchre_NN
that_IN they_PRP caused_VBD their_PRP$ surviving_VBG friends_NNS to_TO convey_VB their_PRP$ mortal_JJ
remains_VBZ to_TO Abydos_NNP ,_, there_RB to_TO tarry_VB for_IN a_DT short_JJ time_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB to_TO be_VB
brought_VBN back_RB by_IN river_NN and_CC interred_VBN in_IN the_DT tombs_NNS which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN made_VBN
ready_JJ for_IN them_PRP in_IN their_PRP$ native_JJ land_NN ._. Others_NNS had_VBD cenotaphs_NNS built_VBN or_CC
memorial_NN tablets_NNS erected_VBD for_IN themselves_PRP near_IN the_DT tomb_NN of_IN their_PRP$ dead_JJ
and_CC risen_VBN Lord_NNP ,_, that_IN they_PRP might_MD share_VB with_IN him_PRP the_DT bliss_NN of_IN a_DT joyful_NN
resurrection_NN ._.



XXXIX_NNP ._. The_DT Ritual_NNP of_IN Osiris_NNP



1._`` The_DT Popular_NNP Rites_NNPS

A_DT USEFUL_NNP clue_NN to_TO the_DT original_JJ nature_NN of_IN a_DT god_NN or_CC goddess_NN is_VBZ often_RB
furnished_VBN by_IN the_DT season_NN at_IN which_WDT his_PRP$ or_CC her_PRP$ festival_NN is_VBZ celebrated_VBN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, if_IN the_DT festival_NN falls_VBZ at_IN the_DT new_JJ or_CC the_DT full_JJ moon_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT
certain_JJ presumption_NN that_IN the_DT deity_NN thus_RB honoured_VBN either_CC is_VBZ the_DT moon_NN
or_CC at_IN least_JJS has_VBZ lunar_NN affinities_NNS ._. If_IN the_DT festival_NN is_VBZ held_VBN at_IN the_DT
winter_NN or_CC summer_NN solstice_NN ,_, we_PRP naturally_RB surmise_VBP that_IN the_DT god_NN is_VBZ the_DT
sun_NN ,_, or_CC at_IN all_DT events_NNS that_IN he_PRP stands_VBZ in_IN some_DT close_JJ relation_NN to_TO that_WDT
luminary_JJ ._. Again_RB ,_, if_IN the_DT festival_NN coincides_VBZ with_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN sowing_NN
or_CC harvest_NN ,_, we_PRP are_VBP inclined_VBN to_TO infer_VB that_IN the_DT divinity_NN is_VBZ an_DT
embodiment_NN of_IN the_DT earth_NN or_CC of_IN the_DT corn_NN ._. These_DT presumptions_NNS or_CC
inferences_NNS ,_, taken_VBN by_IN themselves_PRP ,_, are_VBP by_IN no_DT means_NNS conclusive_JJ ;_: but_CC if_IN
they_PRP happen_VBP to_TO be_VB confirmed_VBN by_IN other_JJ indications_NNS ,_, the_DT evidence_NN may_MD
be_VB regarded_VBN as_RB fairly_RB strong_JJ ._.

Unfortunately_RB ,_, in_IN dealing_VBG with_IN the_DT Egyptian_JJ gods_NNS we_PRP are_VBP in_IN a_DT great_JJ
measure_NN precluded_VBD from_IN making_VBG use_NN of_IN this_DT clue_NN ._. The_DT reason_NN is_VBZ not_RB
that_IN the_DT dates_NNS of_IN the_DT festivals_NNS are_VBP always_RB unknown_JJ ,_, but_CC that_IN they_PRP
shifted_VBN from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ,_, until_IN after_IN a_DT long_JJ interval_NN they_PRP had_VBD
revolved_VBN through_IN the_DT whole_JJ course_NN of_IN the_DT seasons_NNS ._. This_DT gradual_JJ
revolution_NN of_IN the_DT festal_JJ Egyptian_JJ cycle_NN resulted_VBD from_IN the_DT employment_NN
of_IN a_DT calendar_NN year_NN which_WDT neither_RB corresponded_VBD exactly_RB to_TO the_DT solar_JJ
year_NN nor_CC was_VBD periodically_RB corrected_VBN by_IN intercalation_NN ._.

If_IN the_DT Egyptian_JJ farmer_NN of_IN the_DT olden_JJ time_NN could_MD get_VB no_DT help_NN ,_, except_IN
at_IN the_DT rarest_NN intervals_NNS ,_, from_IN the_DT official_JJ or_CC sacerdotal_JJ calendar_NN ,_,
he_PRP must_MD have_VB been_VBN compelled_VBN to_TO observe_VB for_IN himself_PRP those_DT natural_JJ
signals_NNS which_WDT marked_VBD the_DT times_NNS for_IN the_DT various_JJ operations_NNS of_IN
husbandry_NN ._. In_IN all_DT ages_NNS of_IN which_WDT we_PRP possess_VBP any_DT records_NNS the_DT Egyptians_NNS
have_VBP been_VBN an_DT agricultural_JJ people_NNS ,_, dependent_JJ for_IN their_PRP$ subsistence_NN on_IN
the_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT corn_NN ._. The_DT cereals_NNS which_WDT they_PRP cultivated_VBD were_VBD
wheat_NN ,_, barley_NN ,_, and_CC apparently_RB sorghum_NN (_-LRB- Holcus_NNP sorghum_NN ,_, Linnaeus_NNP ),_.
the_DT doora_NN of_IN the_DT modern_JJ fellaheen_NN ._. Then_RB as_IN now_RB the_DT whole_JJ country_NN ,_,
with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN a_DT fringe_NN on_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN the_DT Mediterranean_NNP ,_,
was_VBD almost_RB rainless_JJ ,_, and_CC owed_VBD its_PRP$ immense_JJ fertility_NN entirely_RB to_TO the_DT
annual_JJ inundation_NN of_IN the_DT Nile_NNP ,_, which_WDT ,_, regulated_VBN by_IN an_DT elaborate_JJ
system_NN of_IN dams_NNS and_CC canals_NNS ,_, was_VBD distributed_VBN over_IN the_DT fields_NNS ,_, renewing_VBG
the_DT soil_NN year_NN by_IN year_NN with_IN a_DT fresh_JJ deposit_NN of_IN mud_NN washed_VBD down_RB from_IN
the_DT great_JJ equatorial_JJ lakes_NNS and_CC the_DT mountains_NNS of_IN Abyssinia_NNP ._. Hence_RB the_DT
rise_NN of_IN the_DT river_NN has_VBZ always_RB been_VBN watched_VBN by_IN the_DT inhabitants_NNS with_IN
the_DT utmost_JJ anxiety_NN ;_: for_IN if_IN it_PRP either_RB falls_VBZ short_JJ of_IN or_CC exceeds_VBZ a_DT
certain_JJ height_NN ,_, dearth_NN and_CC famine_NN are_VBP the_DT inevitable_JJ consequences_NNS ._.
The_DT water_NN begins_VBZ to_TO rise_VB early_RB in_IN June_NNP ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB until_IN the_DT
latter_JJ half_NN of_IN July_NNP that_IN it_PRP swells_VBZ to_TO a_DT mighty_JJ tide_NN ._. By_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN
September_NNP the_DT inundation_NN is_VBZ at_IN its_PRP$ greatest_JJS height_NN ._. The_DT country_NN is_VBZ
now_RB submerged_VBN ,_, and_CC presents_VBZ the_DT appearance_NN of_IN a_DT sea_NN of_IN turbid_NN water_NN ,_,
from_IN which_WDT the_DT towns_NNS and_CC villages_NNS ,_, built_VBN on_IN higher_JJR ground_NN ,_, rise_NN like_IN
islands_NNS ._. For_IN about_IN a_DT month_NN the_DT flood_NN remains_VBZ nearly_RB stationary_JJ ,_, then_RB
sinks_NNS more_RBR and_CC more_RBR rapidly_RB ,_, till_IN by_IN December_NNP or_CC January_NNP the_DT river_NN
has_VBZ returned_VBN to_TO its_PRP$ ordinary_JJ bed_NN ._. With_IN the_DT approach_NN of_IN summer_NN the_DT
level_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN continues_VBZ to_TO fall_VB ._. In_IN the_DT early_JJ days_NNS of_IN June_NNP the_DT
Nile_NNP is_VBZ reduced_VBN to_TO half_DT its_PRP$ ordinary_JJ breadth_NN ;_: and_CC Egypt_NNP ,_, scorched_VBN by_IN
the_DT sun_NN ,_, blasted_VBN by_IN the_DT wind_NN that_WDT has_VBZ blown_VBN from_IN the_DT Sahara_NNP for_IN many_JJ
days_NNS ,_, seems_VBZ a_DT mere_JJ continuation_NN of_IN the_DT desert_NN ._. The_DT trees_NNS are_VBP choked_VBN
with_IN a_DT thick_JJ layer_NN of_IN grey_JJ dust_NN ._. A_DT few_JJ meagre_JJ patches_NNS of_IN vegetables_NNS ,_,
watered_VBN with_IN difficulty_NN ,_, struggle_NN painfully_RB for_IN existence_NN in_IN the_DT
immediate_JJ neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT villages_NNS ._. Some_DT appearance_NN of_IN verdure_NN
lingers_VBZ beside_IN the_DT canals_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT hollows_NNS from_IN which_WDT the_DT moisture_NN
has_VBZ not_RB wholly_RB evaporated_VBN ._. The_DT plain_NN appears_VBZ to_TO pant_VB in_IN the_DT pitiless_JJ
sunshine_NN ,_, bare_JJ ,_, dusty_JJ ,_, ash-coloured_JJ ,_, cracked_VBD and_CC seamed_VBD as_RB far_RB as_IN
the_DT eye_NN can_MD see_VB with_IN a_DT network_NN of_IN fissures_NNS ._. From_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN April_NNP
till_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN June_NNP the_DT land_NN of_IN Egypt_NNP is_VBZ but_CC half_DT alive_JJ ,_, waiting_VBG
for_IN the_DT new_JJ Nile_NNP ._.

For_IN countless_JJ ages_NNS this_DT cycle_NN of_IN natural_JJ events_NNS has_VBZ determined_VBN the_DT
annual_JJ labours_NNS of_IN the_DT Egyptian_JJ husbandman_NN ._. The_DT first_JJ work_NN of_IN the_DT
agricultural_JJ year_NN is_VBZ the_DT cutting_NN of_IN the_DT dams_NNS which_WDT have_VBP hitherto_VBN
prevented_VBN the_DT swollen_JJ river_NN from_IN flooding_VBG the_DT canals_NNS and_CC the_DT fields_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ done_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT pent-up_JJ waters_NNS released_VBN on_IN their_PRP$ beneficent_NN
mission_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT first_JJ half_NN of_IN August_NNP ._. In_IN November_NNP ,_, when_WRB the_DT
inundation_NN has_VBZ subsided_VBN ,_, wheat_NN ,_, barley_NN ,_, and_CC sorghum_NN are_VBP sown_VBN ._. The_DT
time_NN of_IN harvest_NN varies_VBZ with_IN the_DT district_NN ,_, falling_VBG about_IN a_DT month_NN
later_RB in_IN the_DT north_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT south_NN ._. In_IN Upper_NNP or_CC Southern_NNP Egypt_NNP
barley_NN is_VBZ reaped_VBN at_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN March_NNP ,_, wheat_NN at_IN the_DT beginning_VBG
of_IN April_NNP ,_, and_CC sorghum_NN about_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN that_DT month_NN ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ natural_JJ to_TO suppose_VB that_IN the_DT various_JJ events_NNS of_IN the_DT agricultural_JJ
year_NN were_VBD celebrated_VBN by_IN the_DT Egyptian_JJ farmer_NN with_IN some_DT simple_NN
religious_JJ rites_NNS designed_VBN to_TO secure_VB the_DT blessing_NN of_IN the_DT gods_NNS upon_IN his_PRP$
labours_NNS ._. These_DT rustic_JJ ceremonies_NNS he_PRP would_MD continue_VB to_TO perform_VB year_NN
after_IN year_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ season_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT solemn_JJ festivals_NNS of_IN the_DT
priests_NNS continued_VBD to_TO shift_VB ,_, with_IN the_DT shifting_VBG calendar_NN ,_, from_IN summer_NN
through_IN spring_NN to_TO winter_NN ,_, and_CC so_RB backward_RB through_IN autumn_NN to_TO summer_NN ._.
The_DT rites_NNS of_IN the_DT husbandman_NN were_VBD stable_JJ because_IN they_PRP rested_VBD on_IN
direct_JJ observation_NN of_IN nature_NN :_: the_DT rites_NNS of_IN the_DT priest_NN were_VBD unstable_JJ
because_IN they_PRP were_VBD based_VBN on_IN a_DT false_JJ calculation_NN ._. Yet_RB many_JJ of_IN the_DT
priestly_RB festivals_NNS may_MD have_VB been_VBN nothing_NN but_CC the_DT old_JJ rural_JJ festivals_NNS
disguised_VBN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN ages_NNS by_IN the_DT pomp_NN of_IN sacerdotalism_NN and_CC
severed_VBN ,_, by_IN the_DT error_NN of_IN the_DT calendar_NN ,_, from_IN their_PRP$ roots_NNS in_IN the_DT
natural_JJ cycle_NN of_IN the_DT seasons_NNS ._.

These_DT conjectures_NNS are_VBP confirmed_VBN by_IN the_DT little_JJ we_PRP know_VBP both_DT of_IN the_DT
popular_JJ and_CC of_IN the_DT official_NN Egyptian_JJ religion_NN ._. Thus_RB we_PRP are_VBP told_VBN that_IN
the_DT Egyptians_NNPS held_VBD a_DT festival_NN of_IN Isis_NNP at_IN the_DT time_NN when_WRB the_DT Nile_NN
began_VBD to_TO rise_VB ._. They_PRP believed_VBD that_IN the_DT goddess_NN was_VBD then_RB mourning_VBG for_IN
the_DT lost_VBN Osiris_NNP ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT tears_NNS which_WDT dropped_VBD from_IN her_PRP$ eyes_NNS
swelled_VBD the_DT impetuous_JJ tide_NN of_IN the_DT river_NN ._. Now_RB if_IN Osiris_NNP was_VBD in_IN one_CD of_IN
his_PRP$ aspects_NNS a_DT god_NN of_IN the_DT corn_NN ,_, nothing_NN could_MD be_VB more_RBR natural_JJ than_IN
that_IN he_PRP should_MD be_VB mourned_VBN at_IN midsummer_NN ._. For_IN by_IN that_DT time_NN the_DT harvest_NN
was_VBD past_JJ ,_, the_DT fields_NNS were_VBD bare_JJ ,_, the_DT river_NN ran_VBD low_JJ ,_, life_NN seemed_VBD to_TO be_VB
suspended_VBN ,_, the_DT corn-god_NN was_VBD dead_JJ ._. At_IN such_JJ a_DT moment_NN people_NNS who_WP saw_VBD
the_DT handiwork_NN of_IN divine_JJ beings_NNS in_IN all_PDT the_DT operations_NNS of_IN nature_NN might_MD
well_RB trace_VB the_DT swelling_VBG of_IN the_DT sacred_JJ stream_NN to_TO the_DT tears_NNS shed_VBN by_IN
the_DT goddess_NN at_IN the_DT death_NN of_IN the_DT beneficent_JJ corn-god_NN her_PRP husband_NN ._.

And_CC the_DT sign_NN of_IN the_DT rising_VBG waters_NNS on_IN earth_NN was_VBD accompanied_VBN by_IN a_DT sign_NN
in_IN heaven_NN ._. For_IN in_IN the_DT early_JJ days_NNS of_IN Egyptian_JJ history_NN ,_, some_DT three_CD or_CC
four_CD thousand_CD years_NNS before_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN our_PRP$ era_NN ,_, the_DT splendid_JJ
star_NN of_IN Sirius_NNP ,_, the_DT brightest_JJS of_IN all_PDT the_DT fixed_VBN stars_NNS ,_, appeared_VBD at_IN
dawn_NN in_IN the_DT east_JJ just_RB before_IN sunrise_NN about_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN the_DT summer_NN
solstice_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT Nile_NNP begins_VBZ to_TO rise_VB ._. The_DT Egyptians_NNPS called_VBD it_PRP
Sothis_NNP ,_, and_CC regarded_VBD it_PRP as_IN the_DT star_NN of_IN Isis_NNP ,_, just_RB as_IN the_DT Babylonians_NNS
deemed_VBN the_DT planet_NN Venus_NNP the_DT star_NN of_IN Astarte_NNP ._. To_TO both_DT peoples_NNS
apparently_RB the_DT brilliant_JJ luminary_JJ in_IN the_DT morning_NN sky_NN seemed_VBD the_DT
goddess_NN of_IN life_NN and_CC love_VB come_VB to_TO mourn_VB her_PRP$ departed_VBN lover_NN or_CC spouse_NN
and_CC to_TO wake_VB him_PRP from_IN the_DT dead_JJ ._. Hence_RB the_DT rising_VBG of_IN Sirius_NNP marked_VBD the_DT
beginning_NN of_IN the_DT sacred_JJ Egyptian_JJ year_NN ,_, and_CC was_VBD regularly_RB celebrated_VBN
by_IN a_DT festival_NN which_WDT did_VBD not_RB shift_VB with_IN the_DT shifting_VBG official_JJ year_NN ._.

The_DT cutting_NN of_IN the_DT dams_NNS and_CC the_DT admission_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN into_IN the_DT
canals_NNS and_CC fields_NNS is_VBZ a_DT great_JJ event_NN in_IN the_DT Egyptian_JJ year_NN ._. At_IN Cairo_NNP
the_DT operation_NN generally_RB takes_VBZ place_NN between_IN the_DT sixth_JJ and_CC the_DT
sixteenth_JJ of_IN August_NNP ,_, and_CC till_IN lately_RB was_VBD attended_VBN by_IN ceremonies_NNS
which_WDT deserve_VBP to_TO be_VB noticed_VBN ,_, because_IN they_PRP were_VBD probably_RB handed_VBN down_RB
from_IN antiquity_NN ._. An_DT ancient_JJ canal_NN ,_, known_VBN by_IN the_DT name_NN of_IN the_DT Khal_NNP �_NNP j_NN ,_,
formerly_RB passed_VBD through_IN the_DT native_JJ town_NN of_IN Cairo_NNP ._. Near_IN its_PRP$ entrance_NN
the_DT canal_NN was_VBD crossed_VBN by_IN a_DT dam_NN of_IN earth_NN ,_, very_RB broad_JJ at_IN the_DT bottom_NN
and_CC diminishing_VBG in_IN breadth_NN upwards_NNS ,_, which_WDT used_VBD to_TO be_VB constructed_VBN
before_IN or_CC soon_RB after_IN the_DT Nile_NNP began_VBD to_TO rise_VB ._. In_IN front_NN of_IN the_DT dam_NN ,_, on_IN
the_DT side_NN of_IN the_DT river_NN ,_, was_VBD reared_VBN a_DT truncated_JJ cone_NN of_IN earth_NN called_VBN
the_DT '_'' arooseh_RB or_CC "_`` bride_NN ,"_NN on_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN which_WDT a_DT little_JJ maize_NN or_CC
millet_NN was_VBD generally_RB sown_VBN ._. This_DT "_`` bride_NN "_'' was_VBD commonly_RB washed_VBN down_RP by_IN
the_DT rising_VBG tide_NN a_DT week_NN or_CC a_DT fortnight_NN before_IN the_DT cutting_NN of_IN the_DT dam_NN ._.
Tradition_NNP runs_VBZ that_IN the_DT old_JJ custom_NN was_VBD to_TO deck_NN a_DT young_JJ virgin_NN in_IN gay_JJ
apparel_NN and_CC throw_VB her_PRP into_IN the_DT river_NN as_IN a_DT sacrifice_NN to_TO obtain_VB a_DT
plentiful_JJ inundation_NN ._. Whether_IN that_DT was_VBD so_RB or_CC not_RB ,_, the_DT intention_NN of_IN
the_DT practice_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN to_TO marry_VB the_DT river_NN ,_, conceived_VBN as_IN a_DT
male_JJ power_NN ,_, to_TO his_PRP$ bride_NN the_DT cornland_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD so_RB soon_RB to_TO be_VB
fertilised_VBN by_IN his_PRP$ water_NN ._. The_DT ceremony_NN was_VBD therefore_RB a_DT charm_NN to_TO
ensure_VB the_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT crops_NNS ._. In_IN modern_JJ times_NNS money_NN used_VBN to_TO be_VB
thrown_VBN into_IN the_DT canal_NN on_IN this_DT occasion_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT populace_NN dived_VBD into_IN
the_DT water_NN after_IN it_PRP ._. This_DT practice_NN also_RB would_MD seem_VB to_TO have_VB been_VBN
ancient_JJ ,_, for_IN Seneca_NNP tells_VBZ us_PRP that_IN at_IN a_DT place_NN called_VBN the_DT Veins_NNP of_IN the_DT
Nile_NNP ,_, not_RB far_RB from_IN Philae_NNP ,_, the_DT priests_NNS used_VBD to_TO cast_VB money_NN and_CC
offerings_NNS of_IN gold_NN into_IN the_DT river_NN at_IN a_DT festival_NN which_WDT apparently_RB took_VBD
place_NN at_IN the_DT rising_VBG of_IN the_DT water_NN ._.

The_DT next_JJ great_JJ operation_NN of_IN the_DT agricultural_JJ year_NN in_IN Egypt_NNP is_VBZ the_DT
sowing_NN of_IN the_DT seed_NN in_IN November_NNP ,_, when_WRB the_DT water_NN of_IN the_DT inundation_NN has_VBZ
retreated_VBN from_IN the_DT fields_NNS ._. With_IN the_DT Egyptians_NNS ,_, as_IN with_IN many_JJ peoples_NNS
of_IN antiquity_NN ,_, the_DT committing_VBG of_IN the_DT seed_NN to_TO the_DT earth_NN assumed_VBD the_DT
character_NN of_IN a_DT solemn_JJ and_CC mournful_JJ rite_NN ._. On_IN this_DT subject_NN I_PRP will_MD let_VB
Plutarch_NNP speak_VBP for_IN himself_PRP ._. "_'' What_WP ,"_VBZ he_PRP asks_VBZ ,_, "_`` are_VBP we_PRP to_TO make_VB of_IN the_DT
gloomy_JJ ,_, joyless_JJ ,_, and_CC mournful_JJ sacrifices_NNS ,_, if_IN it_PRP is_VBZ wrong_JJ either_RB to_TO
omit_VB the_DT established_VBN rites_NNS or_CC to_TO confuse_VB and_CC disturb_VB our_PRP$ conceptions_NNS
of_IN the_DT gods_NNS by_IN absurd_JJ suspicions_NNS ?_. For_IN the_DT Greeks_NNP also_RB perform_VBP many_JJ
rites_NNS which_WDT resemble_VBP those_DT of_IN the_DT Egyptians_NNS and_CC are_VBP observed_VBN about_IN
the_DT same_JJ time_NN ._. Thus_RB at_IN the_DT festival_NN of_IN the_DT Thesmophoria_NNP in_IN Athens_NNP
women_NNS sit_VB on_IN the_DT ground_NN and_CC fast_RB ._. And_CC the_DT Boeotians_NNPS open_VBP the_DT vaults_NNS
of_IN the_DT Sorrowful_JJ One_CD ,_, naming_VBG that_IN festival_NN sorrowful_JJ because_IN Demeter_NN
is_VBZ sorrowing_VBG for_IN the_DT descent_NN of_IN the_DT Maiden_NNP ._. The_DT month_NN is_VBZ the_DT month_NN
of_IN sowing_NN about_IN the_DT setting_NN of_IN the_DT Pleiades_NNS ._. The_DT Egyptians_NNPS call_VBP it_PRP
Athyr_NNP ,_, the_DT Athenians_NNP Pyanepsion_NNP ,_, the_DT Boeotians_NNPS the_DT month_NN of_IN Demeter_NNP ._.
._. ._. ._. For_IN it_PRP was_VBD that_DT time_NN of_IN year_NN when_WRB they_PRP saw_VBD some_DT of_IN the_DT fruits_NNS
vanishing_VBG and_CC failing_VBG from_IN the_DT trees_NNS ,_, while_IN they_PRP sowed_VBD others_NNS
grudgingly_RB and_CC with_IN difficulty_NN ,_, scraping_VBG the_DT earth_NN with_IN their_PRP$ hands_NNS
and_CC huddling_VBG it_PRP up_RP again_RB ,_, on_IN the_DT uncertain_JJ chance_NN that_IN what_WP they_PRP
deposited_VBN in_IN the_DT ground_NN would_MD ever_RB ripen_VB and_CC come_VB to_TO maturity_NN ._. Thus_RB
they_PRP did_VBD in_IN many_JJ respects_NNS like_IN those_DT who_WP bury_VBP and_CC mourn_VB their_PRP$ dead_JJ ."_NN

The_DT Egyptian_JJ harvest_NN ,_, as_IN we_PRP have_VBP seen_VBN ,_, falls_VBZ not_RB in_IN autumn_NN but_CC in_IN
spring_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN March_NNP ,_, April_NNP ,_, and_CC May_NNP ._. To_TO the_DT husbandman_NN
the_DT time_NN of_IN harvest_NN ,_, at_IN least_JJS in_IN a_DT good_JJ year_NN ,_, must_MD necessarily_RB be_VB a_DT
season_NN of_IN joy_NN :_: in_IN bringing_VBG home_NN his_PRP$ sheaves_NNS he_PRP is_VBZ requited_VBN for_IN his_PRP$
long_JJ and_CC anxious_JJ labours_NNS ._. Yet_RB if_IN the_DT old_JJ Egyptian_JJ farmer_NN felt_VBD a_DT
secret_JJ joy_NN at_IN reaping_VBG and_CC garnering_VBG the_DT grain_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD essential_JJ that_IN
he_PRP should_MD conceal_VB the_DT natural_JJ emotion_NN under_IN an_DT air_NN of_IN profound_JJ
dejection_NN ._. For_IN was_VBD he_PRP not_RB severing_JJ the_DT body_NN of_IN the_DT corn-god_NN with_IN his_PRP$
sickle_JJ and_CC trampling_JJ it_PRP to_TO pieces_NNS under_IN the_DT hoofs_NNS of_IN his_PRP$ cattle_NNS on_IN
the_DT threshing-floor_NN ?_. Accordingly_RB we_PRP are_VBP told_VBN that_IN it_PRP was_VBD an_DT ancient_JJ
custom_NN of_IN the_DT Egyptian_JJ corn-reapers_NNS to_TO beat_VB their_PRP$ breasts_NNS and_CC lament_NN
over_IN the_DT first_JJ sheaf_NN cut_NN ,_, while_IN at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN they_PRP called_VBD upon_IN
Isis_NNP ._. The_DT invocation_NN seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB taken_VBN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT melancholy_NN
chant_NN ,_, to_TO which_WDT the_DT Greeks_NNP gave_VBD the_DT name_NN of_IN Maneros_NNP ._. Similar_JJ
plaintive_JJ strains_NNS were_VBD chanted_VBN by_IN corn-reapers_NNS in_IN Phoenicia_NNP and_CC
other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Western_NNP Asia_NNP ._. Probably_RB all_PDT these_DT doleful_JJ ditties_NNS were_VBD
lamentations_NNS for_IN the_DT corn-god_NN killed_VBN by_IN the_DT sickles_NNS of_IN the_DT reapers_NNS ._.
In_IN Egypt_NNP the_DT slain_NN deity_NN was_VBD Osiris_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT name_NN Maneros_NNP ,_, applied_VBN
to_TO the_DT dirge_NN ,_, appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB derived_VBN from_IN certain_JJ words_NNS meaning_VBG "_`` Come_VB
to_TO thy_JJ house_NN ,"_, which_WDT often_RB occur_VBP in_IN the_DT lamentations_NNS for_IN the_DT dead_JJ
god_NN ._.

Ceremonies_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ sort_NN have_VBP been_VBN observed_VBN by_IN other_JJ peoples_NNS ,_,
probably_RB for_IN the_DT same_JJ purpose_NN ._. Thus_RB we_PRP are_VBP told_VBN that_IN among_IN all_PDT
vegetables_NNS corn_NN ,_, by_IN which_WDT is_VBZ apparently_RB meant_VBN maize_NN ,_, holds_VBZ the_DT first_JJ

Cherokee_NNP Indians_NNPS ,_, who_WP invoke_VB it_PRP under_IN the_DT name_NN of_IN "_`` the_DT Old_NNP Woman_NNP "_'' in_IN

The_DT conception_NN of_IN the_DT corn-spirit_NN as_IN old_JJ and_CC dead_JJ at_IN harvest_NN is_VBZ very_RB

2._DT The_DT Official_NNP Rites_NNPS

SUCH_NNP ,_, then_RB ,_, were_VBD the_DT principal_JJ events_NNS of_IN the_DT farmer_NN '_POS s_VBZ calendar_NN in_IN
ancient_JJ Egypt_NNP ,_, and_CC such_JJ the_DT simple_JJ religious_JJ rites_NNS by_IN which_WDT he_PRP
celebrated_VBN them_PRP ._. But_CC we_PRP have_VBP still_RB to_TO consider_VB the_DT Osirian_NNP festivals_NNS
of_IN the_DT official_JJ calendar_NN ,_, so_RB far_RB as_IN these_DT are_VBP described_VBN by_IN Greek_NNP
writers_NNS or_CC recorded_VBN on_IN the_DT monuments_NNS ._. In_IN examining_VBG them_PRP it_PRP is_VBZ

old_JJ Egyptian_JJ calendar_NN the_DT true_JJ or_CC astronomical_JJ dates_NNS of_IN the_DT official_NN

adoption_NN of_IN the_DT fixed_VBN Alexandrian_NNP year_NN in_IN 30_CD B_NNP ._. C_NNP ._. From_IN that_DT time_NN
onward_RB ,_, apparently_RB ,_, the_DT dates_NNS of_IN the_DT festivals_NNS were_VBD determined_VBN by_IN
the_DT new_JJ calendar_NN ,_, and_CC so_RB ceased_VBD to_TO rotate_VB throughout_IN the_DT length_NN of_IN
the_DT solar_JJ year_NN ._. At_IN all_DT events_NNS Plutarch_NNP ,_, writing_VBG about_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT
first_JJ century_NN ,_, implies_VBZ that_IN they_PRP were_VBD then_RB fixed_VBN ,_, not_RB movable_JJ ;_: for_IN
though_IN he_PRP does_VBZ not_RB mention_VB the_DT Alexandrian_NNP calendar_NN ,_, he_PRP clearly_RB
dates_NNS the_DT festivals_NNS by_IN it_PRP ._. Moreover_RB ,_, the_DT long_JJ festal_JJ calendar_NN of_IN
Esne_NNP ,_, an_DT important_JJ document_NN of_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP age_NN ,_, is_VBZ obviously_RB based_VBN
on_IN the_DT fixed_VBN Alexandrian_NNP year_NN ;_: for_IN it_PRP assigns_VBZ the_DT mark_NN for_IN New_NNP
Year_NN '_POS s_VBZ Day_NNP to_TO the_DT day_NN which_WDT corresponds_VBZ to_TO the_DT twenty-ninth_JJ of_IN

onwards_IN the_DT Egyptian_JJ festivals_NNS were_VBD stationary_JJ in_IN the_DT solar_JJ year_NN ._.

Herodotus_NNP tells_VBZ us_PRP that_IN the_DT grave_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP was_VBD at_IN Sais_NNP in_IN Lower_NNP
Egypt_NNP ,_, and_CC that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT lake_NN there_RB upon_IN which_WDT the_DT sufferings_NNS of_IN
the_DT god_NN were_VBD displayed_VBN as_IN a_DT mystery_NN by_IN night_NN ._. This_DT commemoration_NN of_IN
the_DT divine_JJ passion_NN was_VBD held_VBN once_RB a_DT year_NN :_: the_DT people_NNS mourned_VBD and_CC beat_NN
their_PRP$ breasts_NNS at_IN it_PRP to_TO testify_VB their_PRP$ sorrow_NN for_IN the_DT death_NN of_IN the_DT
god_NN ;_: and_CC an_DT image_NN of_IN a_DT cow_NN ,_, made_VBN of_IN gilt_JJ wood_NN with_IN a_DT golden_JJ sun_NN

cow_NN ._. It_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN the_DT carrying_VBG out_RB of_IN her_PRP$ cow-shaped_JJ image_NN

cow_NN was_VBD carried_VBN seven_CD times_NNS round_VBP the_DT temple_NN ._. A_DT great_JJ feature_NN of_IN the_DT

grave_JJ ._. Herodotus_NNP ,_, who_WP briefly_RB describes_VBZ the_DT festival_NN ,_, omits_VBZ to_TO
mention_VB its_PRP$ date_NN ,_, but_CC we_PRP can_MD determine_VB it_PRP with_IN some_DT probability_NN from_IN
other_JJ sources_NNS ._. Thus_RB Plutarch_NNP tells_VBZ us_PRP that_IN Osiris_NNP was_VBD murdered_VBN on_IN

Lactantius_NNP tells_VBZ us_PRP how_WRB on_IN these_DT occasions_NNS the_DT priests_NNS ,_, with_IN their_PRP$

part_NN ,_, not_RB of_IN Osiris_NNP ,_, but_CC of_IN his_PRP$ son_NN Horus_NNP ;_: but_CC as_IN the_DT death_NN and_CC

The_DT funeral_NN rites_NNS of_IN Osiris_NNP ,_, as_IN they_PRP were_VBD observed_VBN at_IN his_PRP$ great_JJ

The_DT rites_NNS lasted_VBD eighteen_CD days_NNS ,_, from_IN the_DT twelfth_NN to_TO the_DT thirtieth_NN of_IN
the_DT month_NN Khoiak_NNP ,_, and_CC set_VBD forth_RB the_DT nature_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP in_IN his_PRP$ triple_JJ
aspect_NN as_IN dead_JJ ,_, dismembered_VBN ,_, and_CC finally_RB reconstituted_VBN by_IN the_DT union_NN
of_IN his_PRP$ scattered_JJ limbs_NNS ._. In_IN the_DT first_JJ of_IN these_DT aspects_NNS he_PRP was_VBD called_VBN

third_JJ Sokari_NNP (_-LRB- Seker_NNP )._VBZ Small_JJ images_NNS of_IN the_DT god_NN were_VBD moulded_VBN of_IN sand_NN
or_CC vegetable_NN earth_NN and_CC corn_NN ,_, to_TO which_WDT incense_NN was_VBD sometimes_RB added_VBN ;_:
his_PRP$ face_NN was_VBD painted_VBN yellow_JJ and_CC his_PRP$ cheek-bones_NNS green_JJ ._. These_DT images_NNS
were_VBD cast_VBN in_IN a_DT mould_NN of_IN pure_JJ gold_NN ,_, which_WDT represented_VBD the_DT god_NN in_IN the_DT
form_NN of_IN a_DT mummy_JJ ,_, with_IN the_DT white_JJ crown_NN of_IN Egypt_NNP on_IN his_PRP$ head_NN ._. The_DT
festival_NN opened_VBD on_IN the_DT twelfth_JJ day_NN of_IN Khoiak_NNP with_IN a_DT ceremony_NN of_IN
ploughing_NN and_CC sowing_NN ._. Two_CD black_JJ cows_NNS were_VBD yoked_VBN to_TO the_DT plough_NN ,_, which_WDT
was_VBD made_VBN of_IN tamarisk_NN wood_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT share_NN was_VBD of_IN black_JJ copper_NN ._. A_DT
boy_NN scattered_VBD the_DT seed_NN ._. One_CD end_NN of_IN the_DT field_NN was_VBD sown_NN with_IN barley_NN ,_,
the_DT other_JJ with_IN spelt_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT middle_NN with_IN flax_NN ._. During_IN the_DT operation_NN
the_DT chief_NN celebrant_NN recited_VBD the_DT ritual_NN chapter_NN of_IN "_`` the_DT sowing_NN of_IN the_DT
fields_NNS ."_VBP At_IN Busiris_NNP on_IN the_DT twentieth_JJ of_IN Khoiak_NNP sand_NN and_CC barley_NN were_VBD
put_VBN in_IN the_DT god_NN '_'' s_PRP "_`` garden_NN ,"_, which_WDT appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN a_DT sort_NN of_IN
large_JJ flower-pot_NN ._. This_DT was_VBD done_VBN in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN the_DT cow-goddess_NN
Shenty_NNP ,_, represented_VBD seemingly_RB by_IN the_DT image_NN of_IN a_DT cow_NN made_VBN of_IN gilt_NN
sycamore_NN wood_NN with_IN a_DT headless_JJ human_JJ image_NN in_IN its_PRP$ inside_NN ._. "_'' Then_RB fresh_JJ

XL_NNP ._. The_DT Nature_NN of_IN Osiris_NN



1._CD Osiris_NNP a_DT Corn-god_NN

THE_DT FOREGOING_NN survey_NN of_IN the_DT myth_NN and_CC ritual_NN of_IN Osiris_NNP may_MD suffice_VB to_TO

the_DT corn_NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB said_VBD to_TO die_VB and_CC come_VB to_TO life_NN again_RB every_DT

priests_NNS had_VBD invested_VBN his_PRP$ worship_NN ,_, the_DT conception_NN of_IN him_PRP as_IN the_DT
corn-god_NN comes_VBZ clearly_RB out_RP in_IN the_DT festival_NN of_IN his_PRP$ death_NN and_CC

time_NN when_WRB the_DT husbandman_NN actually_RB committed_VBN the_DT seed_NN to_TO the_DT earth_NN ._.
On_IN that_DT occasion_NN an_DT effigy_NN of_IN the_DT corn-god_NN ,_, moulded_VBN of_IN earth_NN and_CC

ceremony_NN was_VBD ,_, in_IN fact_NN ,_, a_DT charm_NN to_TO ensure_VB the_DT growth_NN of_IN the_DT corn_NN by_IN
sympathetic_JJ magic_NN ,_, and_CC we_PRP may_MD conjecture_VB that_IN as_IN such_JJ it_PRP was_VBD

stately_NN ritual_NN of_IN the_DT temple_NN ._. In_IN the_DT modern_JJ ,_, but_CC doubtless_RB ancient_JJ ,_,

the_DT harvest-field_NN and_CC praying_VBG that_IN he_PRP may_MD return_VB from_IN the_DT dead_JJ ,_, we_PRP

The_DT details_NNS of_IN his_PRP$ myth_NN fit_NN in_IN well_RB with_IN this_DT interpretation_NN of_IN the_DT
god_NN ._. He_PRP was_VBD said_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT offspring_NN of_IN Sky_NNP and_CC Earth_NNP ._. What_WP more_RBR

is_VBZ true_JJ that_IN the_DT land_NN of_IN Egypt_NNP owed_VBD its_PRP$ fertility_NN directly_RB to_TO the_DT
Nile_NNP and_CC not_RB to_TO showers_NNS ;_: but_CC the_DT inhabitants_NNS must_MD have_VB known_VBN or_CC

fell_VBD in_IN the_DT far_JJ interior_NN ._. Again_RB ,_, the_DT legend_NN that_IN Osiris_NNP was_VBD the_DT
first_JJ to_TO teach_VB men_NNS the_DT use_NN of_IN corn_NN would_MD be_VB most_RBS naturally_RB told_VBN of_IN

the_DT fields_NNS to_TO fertilise_VB them_PRP ._. In_IN modern_JJ Europe_NNP the_DT figure_NN of_IN Death_NN
is_VBZ sometimes_RB torn_VBN in_IN pieces_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT fragments_NNS are_VBP then_RB buried_VBN in_IN

the_DT victims_NNS represented_VBD Osiris_NNP himself_PRP ,_, who_WP was_VBD annually_RB slain_NN ,_,

seed_NN in_IN the_DT earth_NN ._.

Possibly_RB in_IN prehistoric_JJ times_NNS the_DT kings_NNS themselves_PRP played_VBD the_DT part_NN
of_IN the_DT god_NN and_CC were_VBD slain_VBN and_CC dismembered_VBN in_IN that_DT character_NN ._. Set_VB as_RB
well_RB as_IN Osiris_NNP is_VBZ said_VBN to_TO have_VB been_VBN torn_VBN in_IN pieces_NNS after_IN a_DT reign_NN of_IN
eighteen_CD days_NNS ,_, which_WDT was_VBD commemorated_VBN by_IN an_DT annual_JJ festival_NN of_IN the_DT
same_JJ length_NN ._. According_VBG to_TO one_CD story_NN Romulus_NNP ,_, the_DT first_JJ king_NN of_IN Rome_NNP ,_,
was_VBD cut_VBN in_IN pieces_NNS by_IN the_DT senators_NNS ,_, who_WP buried_VBD the_DT fragments_NNS of_IN him_PRP
in_IN the_DT ground_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT traditional_JJ day_NN of_IN his_PRP$ death_NN ,_, the_DT seventh_JJ of_IN

Again_RB ,_, Greek_NNP legend_NN told_VBD how_WRB Pentheus_NNP ,_, king_NN of_IN Thebes_NNP ,_, and_CC Lycurgus_NNP ,_,

beings_NNS ,_, and_CC especially_RB divine_JJ kings_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT character_NN of_IN Dionysus_NNP ,_, a_DT
god_NN who_WP resembled_VBD Osiris_NNP in_IN many_JJ points_NNS and_CC was_VBD said_VBN like_IN him_PRP to_TO

perished_VBN in_IN the_DT character_NN of_IN the_DT god_NN whose_WP$ death_NN he_PRP died_VBD ._. It_PRP is_VBZ

ceased_VBD to_TO be_VB fruitful_JJ ,_, might_MD regain_VB its_PRP$ fertility_NN ._.

Further_RB ,_, we_PRP read_VBD of_IN a_DT Norwegian_JJ king_NN ,_, Halfdan_NNP the_DT Black_NNP ,_, whose_WP$ body_NN
was_VBD cut_VBN up_RP and_CC buried_VBN in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN his_PRP$ kingdom_NN for_IN the_DT sake_NN
of_IN ensuring_VBG the_DT fruitfulness_NN of_IN the_DT earth_NN ._. He_PRP is_VBZ said_VBD to_TO have_VB been_VBN

spring_NN ._. What_WDT followed_VBD his_PRP$ death_NN is_VBZ thus_RB related_VBN by_IN the_DT old_JJ Norse_NN
historian_NN Snorri_NNP Sturluson_NNP :_: "_`` He_PRP had_VBD been_VBN the_DT most_RBS prosperous_JJ
(_-LRB- literally_RB ,_, blessed_VBD with_IN abundance_NN )_-RRB- of_IN all_DT kings_NNS ._. So_RB greatly_RB did_VBD men_NNS
value_NN him_PRP that_IN when_WRB the_DT news_NN came_VBD that_IN he_PRP was_VBD dead_JJ and_CC his_PRP$ body_NN
removed_VBN to_TO Hringariki_NNP and_CC intended_VBN for_IN burial_NN there_RB ,_, the_DT chief_JJ men_NNS
from_IN Raumariki_NNP and_CC Westfold_NNP and_CC Heithm_NNP �_NNP rk_NN came_VBD and_CC all_DT requested_VBN
that_IN they_PRP might_MD take_VB his_PRP$ body_NN with_IN them_PRP and_CC bury_VB it_PRP in_IN their_PRP$ various_JJ
provinces_NNS ;_: they_PRP thought_VBD that_IN it_PRP would_MD bring_VB abundance_NN to_TO those_DT who_WP
obtained_VBN it_PRP ._. Eventually_RB it_PRP was_VBD settled_VBN that_IN the_DT body_NN was_VBD distributed_VBN
in_IN four_CD places_NNS ._. The_DT head_NN was_VBD laid_VBN in_IN a_DT barrow_NN at_IN Steinn_NNP in_IN
Hringariki_NNP ,_, and_CC each_DT party_NN took_VBD away_RP their_PRP$ own_JJ share_NN and_CC buried_VBD it_PRP ._.
All_PDT these_DT barrows_NNS are_VBP called_VBN Halfdan_NNP '_POS s_VBZ barrows_NNS ."_CC It_PRP should_MD be_VB
remembered_VBN that_IN this_DT Halfdan_NNP belonged_VBD to_TO the_DT family_NN of_IN the_DT Ynglings_NNS ,_,
who_WP traced_VBD their_PRP$ descent_NN from_IN Frey_NNP ,_, the_DT great_JJ Scandinavian_JJ god_NN of_IN
fertility_NN ._.

The_DT natives_NNS of_IN Kiwai_NNP ,_, an_DT island_NN lying_VBG off_RP the_DT mouth_NN of_IN the_DT Fly_NNP River_NNP
in_IN British_JJ New_NNP Guinea_NNP ,_, tell_VB of_IN a_DT certain_JJ magician_NN named_VBN Segera_NNP ,_, who_WP

"_`` harvest_NN ";_NN and_CC the_DT ancients_NNS sometimes_RB explained_VBD him_PRP as_IN a_DT

2._CD Osiris_NNP a_DT Tree-spirit_NN

3._CD Osiris_NNP a_DT God_NNP of_IN Fertility_NNP

4._CD Osiris_NNP a_DT God_NNP of_IN the_DT Dead_NNP

XLI_NNP ._. Isis_''

THE_DT ORIGINAL_JJ meaning_NN of_IN the_DT goddess_JJ Isis_NNP is_VBZ still_RB more_RBR difficult_JJ to_TO

of_IN religions_NNS which_WDT accompanied_VBD the_DT decline_NN of_IN national_JJ life_NN in_IN

XLII_NNP ._. Osiris_NNP and_CC the_DT Sun_NNP

OSIRIS_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN sometimes_RB interpreted_VBN as_IN the_DT sun-god_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN modern_JJ
times_NNS this_DT view_NN has_VBZ been_VBN held_VBN by_IN so_RB many_JJ distinguished_JJ writers_NNS that_WDT

learned_JJ man_NN is_VBZ ignorant_JJ of_IN the_DT fact_NN ._. Of_IN the_DT ancient_JJ writers_NNS whom_WP he_PRP

with_IN the_DT sun_NN are_VBP Diodorus_NNP and_CC Macrobius_NNP ._. But_CC little_JJ weight_NN can_MD be_VB

The_DT ground_NN upon_IN which_WDT some_DT modern_JJ writers_NNS seem_VBP chiefly_RB to_TO rely_VB for_IN

in_IN what_WP sense_NN can_MD he_PRP be_VB said_VBD to_TO be_VB torn_VBN in_IN pieces_NNS ?_.

In_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN our_PRP$ enquiry_NN it_PRP has_VBZ ,_, I_PRP trust_VBP ,_, been_VBN made_VBN clear_JJ that_IN

XLIII_NNP ._. Dionysus_NNP

IN_IN THE_DT PRECEDING_NN chapters_NNS we_PRP saw_VBD that_IN in_IN antiquity_NN the_DT civilised_JJ

of_IN the_DT seasons_NNS ,_, and_CC particularly_RB the_DT annual_JJ growth_NN and_CC decay_NN of_IN

form_NN dramatic_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD in_IN substance_NN magical_JJ ;_: that_DT is_VBZ to_TO say_VB ,_, it_PRP was_VBD
intended_VBN ,_, on_IN the_DT principles_NNS of_IN sympathetic_JJ magic_NN ,_, to_TO ensure_VB the_DT

ancient_JJ world_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, such_JJ ideas_NNS and_CC such_JJ rites_NNS were_VBD by_IN no_DT means_NNS

shores_NNS and_CC islands_NNS of_IN the_DT Aegean_NNP ._. We_PRP need_VBP not_RB ,_, with_IN some_DT enquirers_NNS

borrowed_VBN from_IN the_DT older_JJR civilisation_NN of_IN the_DT Orient_NNP the_DT conception_NN of_IN

the_DT worshippers_NNS ._. More_RBR probably_RB the_DT resemblance_NN which_WDT may_MD be_VB traced_VBN
in_IN this_DT respect_NN between_IN the_DT religions_NNS of_IN the_DT East_NNP and_CC West_NNP is_VBZ no_RB

under_IN different_JJ skies_NNS ._. The_DT Greek_NNP had_VBD no_DT need_NN to_TO journey_VB into_IN far_RB
countries_NNS to_TO learn_VB the_DT vicissitudes_NNS of_IN the_DT seasons_NNS ,_, to_TO mark_VB the_DT

of_IN fresh_JJ life_NN in_IN spring_NN ._. Accustomed_NNP to_TO personify_VB the_DT forces_NNS of_IN

The_DT god_NN Dionysus_NNP or_CC Bacchus_NNP is_VBZ best_RB known_VBN to_TO us_PRP as_IN a_DT personification_NN
of_IN the_DT vine_NN and_CC of_IN the_DT exhilaration_NN produced_VBN by_IN the_DT juice_NN of_IN the_DT

preponderance_NN of_IN evidence_NN points_NNS to_TO his_PRP$ Thracian_JJ origin_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT
similarity_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD worships_NNS is_VBZ sufficiently_RB explained_VBN by_IN the_DT
similarity_NN of_IN the_DT ideas_NNS and_CC customs_NNS on_IN which_WDT they_PRP were_VBD founded_VBN ._.

While_IN the_DT vine_NN with_IN its_PRP$ clusters_NNS was_VBD the_DT most_RBS characteristic_JJ
manifestation_NN of_IN Dionysus_NNP ,_, he_PRP was_VBD also_RB a_DT god_NN of_IN trees_NNS in_IN general_JJ ._.
Thus_RB we_PRP are_VBP told_VBN that_IN almost_RB all_DT the_DT Greeks_NNP sacrificed_VBD to_TO "_'' Dionysus_JJ
of_IN the_DT tree_NN ."_NN In_IN Boeotia_NNP one_CD of_IN his_PRP$ titles_NNS was_VBD "_`` Dionysus_JJ in_IN the_DT
tree_NN ."_WP His_PRP$ image_NN was_VBD often_RB merely_RB an_DT upright_JJ post_NN ,_, without_IN arms_NNS ,_, but_CC
draped_VBD in_IN a_DT mantle_JJ ,_, with_IN a_DT bearded_JJ mask_NN to_TO represent_VB the_DT head_NN ,_, and_CC
with_IN leafy_JJ boughs_NNS projecting_VBG from_IN the_DT head_NN or_CC body_NN to_TO show_VB the_DT
nature_NN of_IN the_DT deity_NN ._. On_IN a_DT vase_JJ his_PRP$ rude_JJ effigy_NN is_VBZ depicted_VBN appearing_VBG
out_IN of_IN a_DT low_JJ tree_NN or_CC bush_NN ._. At_IN Magnesia_NNP on_IN the_DT Maeander_NNP an_DT image_NN of_IN
Dionysus_NNP is_VBZ said_VBN to_TO have_VB been_VBN found_VBN in_IN a_DT plane-tree_NN ,_, which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN

we_PRP cannot_MD doubt_VB that_IN in_IN rending_NN and_CC devouring_VBG a_DT live_JJ bull_NN at_IN his_PRP$
festival_NN the_DT worshippers_NNS of_IN Dionysus_NNP believed_VBD themselves_PRP to_TO be_VB
killing_VBG the_DT god_NN ,_, eating_VBG his_PRP$ flesh_NN ,_, and_CC drinking_VBG his_PRP$ blood_NN ._.

Another_DT animal_NN whose_WP$ form_NN Dionysus_NNP assumed_VBD was_VBD the_DT goat_NN ._. One_CD of_IN his_PRP$
names_NNS was_VBD "_`` Kid_NNP ."_VBZ At_IN Athens_NNP and_CC at_IN Hermion_NNP he_PRP was_VBD worshipped_VBN under_IN
the_DT title_NN of_IN "_`` the_DT one_CD of_IN the_DT Black_NNP Goatskin_NNP ,"_, and_CC a_DT legend_NN ran_VBD that_IN

was_VBD turned_VBN into_IN a_DT goat_NN ._. Hence_RB when_WRB his_PRP$ worshippers_NNS rent_VB in_IN pieces_NNS a_DT

were_VBD eating_VBG the_DT body_NN and_CC blood_NN of_IN the_DT god_NN ._. The_DT custom_NN of_IN tearing_VBG in_IN
pieces_NNS the_DT bodies_NNS of_IN animals_NNS and_CC of_IN men_NNS and_CC then_RB devouring_VBG them_PRP raw_JJ
has_VBZ been_VBN practised_VBN as_IN a_DT religious_JJ rite_NN by_IN savages_NNS in_IN modern_JJ times_NNS ._.
We_PRP need_VBP not_RB therefore_RB dismiss_VB as_IN a_DT fable_JJ the_DT testimony_NN of_IN antiquity_NN

Bacchus_NN ._.

The_DT custom_NN of_IN killing_VBG a_DT god_NN in_IN animal_NN form_NN ,_, which_WDT we_PRP shall_MD examine_VB

culture_NN ,_, and_CC is_VBZ apt_JJ in_IN later_JJ times_NNS to_TO be_VB misunderstood_VBN ._. The_DT advance_NN
of_IN thought_NN tends_VBZ to_TO strip_VB the_DT old_JJ animal_NN and_CC plant_NN gods_NNS of_IN their_PRP$
bestial_JJ and_CC vegetable_NN husk_NN ,_, and_CC to_TO leave_VB their_PRP$ human_JJ attributes_NNS
(_-LRB- which_WDT are_VBP always_RB the_DT kernel_NN of_IN the_DT conception_NN )_-RRB- as_IN the_DT final_JJ and_CC
sole_JJ residuum_NN ._. In_IN other_JJ words_NNS ,_, animal_NN and_CC plant_NN gods_NNS tend_VBP to_TO become_VB
purely_RB anthropomorphic_JJ ._. When_WRB they_PRP have_VBP become_VBN wholly_RB or_CC nearly_RB so_RB ,_,
the_DT animals_NNS and_CC plants_NNS which_WDT were_VBD at_IN first_RB the_DT deities_NNS themselves_PRP ,_,

propitiate_VB dead_JJ bears_NNS and_CC whales_NNS by_IN offering_VBG them_PRP portions_NNS of_IN their_PRP$

All_PDT this_DT ,_, however_RB ,_, does_VBZ not_RB explain_VB why_WRB a_DT deity_NN of_IN vegetation_NN should_MD

The_DT legends_NNS of_IN the_DT deaths_NNS of_IN Pentheus_NNP and_CC Lycurgus_NNP ,_, two_CD kings_NNS who_WP
are_VBP said_VBD to_TO have_VB been_VBN torn_VBN to_TO pieces_NNS ,_, the_DT one_CD by_IN Bacchanals_NNS ,_, the_DT

However_RB ,_, a_DT tradition_NN of_IN human_JJ sacrifice_NN may_MD sometimes_RB have_VB been_VBN a_DT

This_DT interpretation_NN is_VBZ supported_VBN by_IN many_JJ undoubted_JJ cases_NNS in_IN which_WDT
animals_NNS have_VBP been_VBN substituted_VBN for_IN human_JJ victims_NNS ._.



XLIV_NNP ._. Demeter_NNP and_CC Persephone_NNP

DIONYSUS_NNP was_VBD not_RB the_DT only_JJ Greek_NNP deity_NN whose_WP$ tragic_JJ story_NN and_CC ritual_NN
appear_VB to_TO reflect_VB the_DT decay_NN and_CC revival_NN of_IN vegetation_NN ._. In_IN another_DT
form_NN and_CC with_IN a_DT different_JJ application_NN the_DT old_JJ tale_NN reappears_VBZ in_IN the_DT
myth_NN of_IN Demeter_NNP and_CC Persephone_NNP ._. Substantially_NNP their_PRP$ myth_NN is_VBZ
identical_JJ with_IN the_DT Syrian_JJ one_CD of_IN Aphrodite_NNP (_-LRB- Astarte_NN )_-RRB- and_CC Adonis_NNP ,_, the_DT
Phrygian_JJ one_CD of_IN Cybele_NNP and_CC Attis_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT Egyptian_JJ one_CD of_IN Isis_NNP and_CC
Osiris_NNP ._. In_IN the_DT Greek_NNP fable_NN ,_, as_IN in_IN its_PRP$ Asiatic_JJ and_CC Egyptian_JJ
counterparts_NNS ,_, a_DT goddess_JJ mourns_NNS the_DT loss_NN of_IN a_DT loved_VBD one_CD ,_, who_WP
personifies_VBZ the_DT vegetation_NN ,_, more_RBR especially_RB the_DT corn_NN ,_, which_WDT dies_VBZ in_IN
winter_NN to_TO revive_VB in_IN spring_NN ;_: only_RB whereas_IN the_DT Oriental_JJ imagination_NN
figured_VBD the_DT loved_VBN and_CC lost_VBN one_CD as_IN a_DT dead_JJ lover_NN or_CC a_DT dead_JJ husband_NN
lamented_VBN by_IN his_PRP$ leman_NN or_CC his_PRP$ wife_NN ,_, Greek_NNP fancy_NN embodied_VBD the_DT same_JJ
idea_NN in_IN the_DT tenderer_NN and_CC purer_NN form_NN of_IN a_DT dead_JJ daughter_NN bewailed_VBN by_IN
her_PRP$ sorrowing_JJ mother_NN ._.

The_DT oldest_JJS literary_JJ document_NN which_WDT narrates_VBZ the_DT myth_NN of_IN Demeter_NNP and_CC
Persephone_NNP is_VBZ the_DT beautiful_JJ Homeric_NNP Hymn_NN to_TO Demeter_NNP ,_, which_WDT critics_NNS
assign_NN to_TO the_DT seventh_JJ century_NN before_RB our_PRP$ era_NN ._. The_DT object_NN of_IN the_DT poem_NN
is_VBZ to_TO explain_VB the_DT origin_NN of_IN the_DT Eleusinian_JJ mysteries_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT
complete_JJ silence_NN of_IN the_DT poet_NN as_IN to_TO Athens_NNP and_CC the_DT Athenians_NNPS ,_, who_WP in_IN
after_IN ages_NNS took_VBD conspicuous_JJ part_NN in_IN the_DT festival_NN ,_, renders_VBD it_PRP
probable_JJ that_IN the_DT hymn_NN was_VBD composed_VBN in_IN the_DT far_RB off_RP time_NN when_WRB Eleusis_NNP
was_VBD still_RB a_DT petty_JJ independent_JJ state_NN ,_, and_CC before_IN the_DT stately_NN

days_NNS ,_, over_IN the_DT low_JJ chain_NN of_IN barren_JJ rocky_JJ hills_NNS which_WDT divides_VBZ the_DT
flat_JJ Eleusinian_JJ cornland_NN from_IN the_DT more_RBR spacious_JJ olive-clad_JJ expanse_NN
of_IN the_DT Athenian_JJ plain_JJ ._. Be_VB that_IN as_IN it_PRP may_MD ,_, the_DT hymn_NN reveals_VBZ to_TO us_PRP the_DT
conception_NN which_WDT the_DT writer_NN entertained_VBN of_IN the_DT character_NN and_CC
functions_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD goddesses_NNS ;_: their_PRP$ natural_JJ shapes_NNS stand_VBP out_IN
sharply_RB enough_RB under_IN the_DT thin_JJ veil_NN of_IN poetical_JJ imagery_NN ._. The_DT youthful_JJ
Persephone_NNP ,_, so_RB runs_VBZ the_DT tale_NN ,_, was_VBD gathering_NN roses_NNS and_CC lilies_NNS ,_,
crocuses_NNS and_CC violets_NNS ,_, hyacinths_NNS and_CC narcissuses_NNS in_IN a_DT lush_JJ meadow_NN ,_,
when_WRB the_DT earth_NN gaped_VBD and_CC Pluto_NNP ,_, lord_NN of_IN the_DT Dead_NNP ,_, issuing_VBG from_IN the_DT
abyss_NN carried_VBD her_PRP off_RP on_IN his_PRP$ golden_JJ car_NN to_TO be_VB his_PRP$ bride_NN and_CC queen_NN in_IN
the_DT gloomy_JJ subterranean_JJ world_NN ._. Her_PRP$ sorrowing_JJ mother_NN Demeter_NNP ,_, with_IN
her_PRP$ yellow_JJ tresses_NNS veiled_VBN in_IN a_DT dark_JJ mourning_VBG mantle_JJ ,_, sought_VBD her_PRP over_IN
land_NN and_CC sea_NN ,_, and_CC learning_VBG from_IN the_DT Sun_NNP her_PRP$ daughter_NN '_'' s_PRP fate_NN she_PRP
withdrew_VBD in_IN high_JJ dudgeon_NN from_IN the_DT gods_NNS and_CC took_VBD up_RP her_PRP$ abode_NN at_IN
Eleusis_NNP ,_, where_WRB she_PRP presented_VBD herself_PRP to_TO the_DT king_NN '_POS s_PRP daughters_NNS in_IN the_DT
guise_NN of_IN an_DT old_JJ woman_NN ,_, sitting_VBG sadly_RB under_IN the_DT shadow_NN of_IN an_DT olive_JJ
tree_NN beside_IN the_DT Maiden_NNP '_POS s_PRP Well_RB ,_, to_TO which_WDT the_DT damsels_NNS had_VBD come_VBN to_TO draw_VB
water_NN in_IN bronze_JJ pitchers_NNS for_IN their_PRP$ father_NN '_'' s_PRP house_NN ._. In_IN her_PRP$ wrath_NN at_IN
her_PRP bereavement_NN the_DT goddess_NN suffered_VBD not_RB the_DT seed_NN to_TO grow_VB in_IN the_DT
earth_NN but_CC kept_VBD it_PRP hidden_JJ under_IN ground_NN ,_, and_CC she_PRP vowed_VBD that_DT never_RB
would_MD she_PRP set_VB foot_NN on_IN Olympus_NNP and_CC never_RB would_MD she_PRP let_VB the_DT corn_NN
sprout_NN till_IN her_PRP$ lost_VBN daughter_NN should_MD be_VB restored_VBN to_TO her_PRP ._. Vainly_RB the_DT
oxen_NNS dragged_VBD the_DT ploughs_NNS to_TO and_CC fro_IN in_IN the_DT fields_NNS ;_: vainly_RB the_DT sower_NN
dropped_VBD the_DT barley_NN seed_NN in_IN the_DT brown_JJ furrows_NNS ;_: nothing_NN came_VBD up_RP from_IN
the_DT parched_VBN and_CC crumbling_VBG soil_NN ._. Even_RB the_DT Rarian_NNP plain_NN near_IN Eleusis_NNP ,_,
which_WDT was_VBD wont_JJ to_TO wave_VB with_IN yellow_JJ harvests_NNS ,_, lay_VBD bare_JJ and_CC fallow_JJ ._.
Mankind_NNP would_MD have_VB perished_VBN of_IN hunger_NN and_CC the_DT gods_NNS would_MD have_VB been_VBN
robbed_VBN of_IN the_DT sacrifices_NNS which_WDT were_VBD their_PRP$ due_JJ ,_, if_IN Zeus_NNP in_IN alarm_NN had_VBN
not_RB commanded_VBD Pluto_NNP to_TO disgorge_VB his_PRP$ prey_NN ,_, to_TO restore_VB his_PRP$ bride_NN
Persephone_NNP to_TO her_PRP$ mother_NN Demeter_NNP ._. The_DT grim_JJ lord_NN of_IN the_DT Dead_NNP smiled_VBD
and_CC obeyed_VBD ,_, but_CC before_IN he_PRP sent_VBD back_RB his_PRP$ queen_NN to_TO the_DT upper_JJ air_NN on_IN a_DT
golden_JJ car_NN ,_, he_PRP gave_VBD her_PRP the_DT seed_NN of_IN a_DT pomegranate_NN to_TO eat_VB ,_, which_WDT
ensured_VBD that_IN she_PRP would_MD return_VB to_TO him_PRP ._. But_CC Zeus_NNP stipulated_VBD that_IN
henceforth_RB Persephone_NNP should_MD spend_VB two_CD thirds_NNS of_IN every_DT year_NN with_IN her_PRP$
mother_NN and_CC the_DT gods_NNS in_IN the_DT upper_JJ world_NN and_CC one_CD third_JJ of_IN the_DT year_NN
with_IN her_PRP$ husband_NN in_IN the_DT nether_JJ world_NN ,_, from_IN which_WDT she_PRP was_VBD to_TO return_VB
year_NN by_IN year_NN when_WRB the_DT earth_NN was_VBD gay_JJ with_IN spring_NN flowers_NNS ._. Gladly_'' the_DT
daughter_NN then_RB returned_VBD to_TO the_DT sunshine_NN ,_, gladly_RB her_PRP$ mother_NN received_VBN
her_PRP and_CC fell_VBD upon_IN her_PRP$ neck_NN ;_: and_CC in_IN her_PRP$ joy_NN at_IN recovering_VBG the_DT lost_VBN
one_CD Demeter_NNP made_VBD the_DT corn_NN to_TO sprout_VB from_IN the_DT clods_NNS of_IN the_DT ploughed_VBN
fields_NNS and_CC all_PDT the_DT broad_JJ earth_NN to_TO be_VB heavy_JJ with_IN leaves_NNS and_CC blossoms_NNS ._.
And_CC straightway_RB she_PRP went_VBD and_CC showed_VBD this_DT happy_JJ sight_NN to_TO the_DT princes_NNS
of_IN Eleusis_NNP ,_, to_TO Triptolemus_NNP ,_, Eumolpus_NNP ,_, Diocles_NNS ,_, and_CC to_TO the_DT king_NN
Celeus_NNP himself_PRP ,_, and_CC moreover_RB she_PRP revealed_VBD to_TO them_PRP her_PRP$ sacred_JJ rites_NNS
and_CC mysteries_NNS ._. Blessed_NN ,_, says_VBZ the_DT poet_NN ,_, is_VBZ the_DT mortal_JJ man_NN who_WP has_VBZ
seen_VBN these_DT things_NNS ,_, but_CC he_PRP who_WP has_VBZ had_VBN no_DT share_NN of_IN them_PRP in_IN life_NN will_MD
never_RB be_VB happy_JJ in_IN death_NN when_WRB he_PRP has_VBZ descended_VBN into_IN the_DT darkness_NN of_IN
the_DT grave_NN ._. So_IN the_DT two_CD goddesses_NNS departed_VBD to_TO dwell_VB in_IN bliss_NN with_IN the_DT
gods_NNS on_IN Olympus_NNP ;_: and_CC the_DT bard_NN ends_VBZ the_DT hymn_NN with_IN a_DT pious_JJ prayer_NN to_TO
Demeter_NNP and_CC Persephone_NNP that_IN they_PRP would_MD be_VB pleased_VBN to_TO grant_VB him_PRP a_DT
livelihood_NN in_IN return_NN for_IN his_PRP$ song_NN ._.

It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN generally_RB recognised_VBN ,_, and_CC indeed_RB it_PRP seems_VBZ scarcely_RB open_JJ
to_TO doubt_NN ,_, that_IN the_DT main_JJ theme_NN which_WDT the_DT poet_NN set_VBN before_IN himself_PRP in_IN
composing_VBG this_DT hymn_NN was_VBD to_TO describe_VB the_DT traditional_JJ foundation_NN of_IN
the_DT Eleusinian_JJ mysteries_NNS by_IN the_DT goddess_JJ Demeter_NNP ._. The_DT whole_NN poem_NN
leads_VBZ up_RP to_TO the_DT transformation_NN scene_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT bare_JJ leafless_JJ

was_VBD regularly_RB applied_VBN to_TO them_PRP in_IN the_DT great_JJ sanctuary_NN at_IN Eleusis_NNP

Surveying_VBG the_DT evidence_NN as_IN a_DT whole_JJ ,_, we_PRP are_VBP fairly_RB entitled_VBN to_TO

explanation_NN ._. But_CC to_TO maintain_VB this_DT is_VBZ not_RB to_TO deny_VB that_IN in_IN the_DT long_JJ

were_VBD grafted_VBN on_IN this_DT simple_NN original_JJ stock_NN and_CC blossomed_VBD out_RB into_IN

all_DT ,_, the_DT thought_NN of_IN the_DT seed_NN buried_VBN in_IN the_DT earth_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO spring_VB
up_IN to_TO new_JJ and_CC higher_JJR life_NN readily_RB suggested_VBD a_DT comparison_NN with_IN human_JJ
destiny_NN ,_, and_CC strengthened_VBD the_DT hope_NN that_IN for_IN man_NN too_RB the_DT grave_NN may_MD be_VB
but_CC the_DT beginning_NN of_IN a_DT better_JJR and_CC happier_JJR existence_NN in_IN some_DT brighter_NN
world_NN unknown_JJ ._. This_DT simple_NN and_CC natural_JJ reflection_NN seems_VBZ perfectly_RB
sufficient_JJ to_TO explain_VB the_DT association_NN of_IN the_DT Corn_NNP Goddess_NNP at_IN Eleusis_NNP
with_IN the_DT mystery_NN of_IN death_NN and_CC the_DT hope_NN of_IN a_DT blissful_JJ immortality_NN ._.
For_IN that_IN the_DT ancients_NNS regarded_VBD initiation_NN in_IN the_DT Eleusinian_JJ
mysteries_NNS as_IN a_DT key_NN to_TO unlock_VB the_DT gates_NNS of_IN Paradise_NNP appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB

to_TO the_DT happiness_NN in_IN store_NN for_IN the_DT initiated_VBN hereafter_IN ._. No_DT doubt_NN it_PRP
is_VBZ easy_JJ for_IN us_PRP to_TO discern_VB the_DT flimsiness_NN of_IN the_DT logical_JJ foundation_NN
on_IN which_WDT such_JJ high_JJ hopes_NNS were_VBD built_VBN ._. But_CC drowning_VBG men_NNS clutch_VBP at_IN
straws_NNS ,_, and_CC we_PRP need_VBP not_RB wonder_VB that_IN the_DT Greeks_NNP ,_, like_IN ourselves_PRP ,_, with_IN
death_NN before_IN them_PRP and_CC a_DT great_JJ love_NN of_IN life_NN in_IN their_PRP$ hearts_NNS ,_, should_MD
not_RB have_VB stopped_VBN to_TO weigh_VB with_IN too_RB nice_JJ a_DT hand_NN the_DT arguments_NNS that_WDT
told_VBN for_IN and_CC against_IN the_DT prospect_NN of_IN human_JJ immortality_NN ._. The_DT
reasoning_NN that_IN satisfied_JJ Saint_NNP Paul_NNP and_CC has_VBZ brought_VBN comfort_NN to_TO
untold_JJ thousands_NNS of_IN sorrowing_DT Christians_NNPS ,_, standing_VBG by_IN the_DT deathbed_NN
or_CC the_DT open_JJ grave_NN of_IN their_PRP$ loved_VBN ones_NNS ,_, was_VBD good_JJ enough_RB to_TO pass_VB
muster_NN with_IN ancient_JJ pagans_NNS ,_, when_WRB they_PRP too_RB bowed_VBD their_PRP$ heads_NNS under_IN
the_DT burden_NN of_IN grief_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, with_IN the_DT taper_NN of_IN life_NN burning_VBG low_JJ in_IN the_DT
socket_NN ,_, looked_VBD forward_RB into_IN the_DT darkness_NN of_IN the_DT unknown_JJ ._. Therefore_CC
we_PRP do_VBP no_DT indignity_NN to_TO the_DT myth_NN of_IN Demeter_NNP and_CC Persephone_NNP --_: one_CD of_IN the_DT
few_JJ myths_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT sunshine_NN and_CC clarity_NN of_IN the_DT Greek_NNP genius_NN are_VBP
crossed_VBN by_IN the_DT shadow_NN and_CC mystery_NN of_IN death_NN --_: when_WRB we_PRP trace_NN its_PRP$ origin_NN
to_TO some_DT of_IN the_DT most_RBS familiar_JJ ,_, yet_RB eternally_RB affecting_VBG aspects_NNS of_IN
nature_NN ,_, to_TO the_DT melancholy_JJ gloom_NN and_CC decay_NN of_IN autumn_NN and_CC to_TO the_DT
freshness_NN ,_, the_DT brightness_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT verdure_NN of_IN spring_NN ._.



XLV_NNP ._. The_DT Corn-Mother_NNP and_CC the_DT Corn-Maiden_NNP in_IN Northern_NNP Europe_NNP

IT_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN argued_VBN by_IN W_NNP ._. Mannhardt_NNP that_IN the_DT first_JJ part_NN of_IN Demeter_NNP '_POS s_PRP
name_NN is_VBZ derived_VBN from_IN an_DT alleged_JJ Cretan_NNP word_NN deai_FW ,_, "_`` barley_NN ,"_NN and_CC
that_IN accordingly_RB Demeter_NNP means_VBZ neither_DT more_RBR nor_CC less_RBR than_IN
"_`` Barley-mother_NNP "_'' or_CC "_`` Corn-mother_JJ ";_NN for_IN the_DT root_NN of_IN the_DT word_NN seems_VBZ to_TO
have_VBP been_VBN applied_VBN to_TO different_JJ kinds_NNS of_IN grain_NN by_IN different_JJ branches_NNS
of_IN the_DT Aryans_NNP ._. As_IN Crete_NNP appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN one_CD of_IN the_DT most_RBS ancient_JJ
seats_NNS of_IN the_DT worship_NN of_IN Demeter_NNP ,_, it_PRP would_MD not_RB be_VB surprising_JJ if_IN her_PRP$
name_NN were_VBD of_IN Cretan_NNP origin_NN ._. But_CC the_DT etymology_NN is_VBZ open_JJ to_TO serious_JJ
objections_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ safer_JJR therefore_RB to_TO lay_VB no_DT stress_NN on_IN it_PRP ._. Be_VB
that_IN as_IN it_PRP may_MD ,_, we_PRP have_VBP found_VBN independent_JJ reasons_NNS for_IN identifying_VBG
Demeter_NN as_IN the_DT Corn-mother_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN the_DT two_CD species_NNS of_IN corn_NN
associated_VBN with_IN her_PRP$ in_IN Greek_NNP religion_NN ,_, namely_RB barley_NN and_CC wheat_NN ,_, the_DT
barley_NN has_VBZ perhaps_RB the_DT better_JJR claim_NN to_TO be_VB her_PRP$ original_JJ element_NN ;_: for_IN
not_RB only_RB would_MD it_PRP seem_VB to_TO have_VB been_VBN the_DT staple_NN food_NN of_IN the_DT Greeks_NNP in_IN
the_DT Homeric_NNP age_NN ,_, but_CC there_EX are_VBP grounds_NNS for_IN believing_VBG that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ one_CD
of_IN the_DT oldest_JJS ,_, if_IN not_RB the_DT very_JJ oldest_JJS ,_, cereal_NN cultivated_VBN by_IN the_DT
Aryan_JJ race_NN ._. Certainly_RB the_DT use_NN of_IN barley_NN in_IN the_DT religious_JJ ritual_NN of_IN
the_DT ancient_JJ Hindoos_NNP as_RB well_RB as_IN of_IN the_DT ancient_JJ Greeks_NNS furnishes_VBZ a_DT
strong_JJ argument_NN in_IN favour_NN of_IN the_DT great_JJ antiquity_NN of_IN its_PRP$ cultivation_NN ,_,
which_WDT is_VBZ known_VBN to_TO have_VB been_VBN practised_VBN by_IN the_DT lake-dwellers_NNS of_IN the_DT
Stone_NNP Age_NNP in_IN Europe_NNP ._.

Analogies_NNS to_TO the_DT Corn-mother_JJ or_CC Barley-mother_NNP of_IN ancient_JJ Greece_NNP have_VB
been_VBN collected_VBN in_IN great_JJ abundance_NN by_IN W_NNP ._. Mannhardt_NNP from_IN the_DT folk-lore_NN
of_IN modern_JJ Europe_NNP ._. The_DT following_NN may_MD serve_VB as_IN specimens_NNS ._.

In_IN Germany_NNP the_DT corn_NN is_VBZ very_RB commonly_RB personified_VBN under_IN the_DT name_NN of_IN
the_DT Corn-mother_NN ._. Thus_RB in_IN spring_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT corn_NN waves_NNS in_IN the_DT wind_NN ,_,
the_DT peasants_NNS say_VBP ,_, "_'' There_RB comes_VBZ the_DT Corn-mother_JJ ,"_NN or_CC "_`` The_DT Corn-mother_JJ
is_VBZ running_VBG over_IN the_DT field_NN ,"_, or_CC "_`` The_DT Corn-mother_NN is_VBZ going_VBG through_IN the_DT
corn_NN ."_NN When_WRB children_NNS wish_VBP to_TO go_VB into_IN the_DT fields_NNS to_TO pull_VB the_DT blue_NN
corn-flowers_NNS or_CC the_DT red_JJ poppies_NNS ,_, they_PRP are_VBP told_VBN not_RB to_TO do_VB so_RB ,_, because_IN
the_DT Corn-mother_NNP is_VBZ sitting_VBG in_IN the_DT corn_NN and_CC will_MD catch_VB them_PRP ._. Or_CC again_RB
she_PRP is_VBZ called_VBN ,_, according_VBG to_TO the_DT crop_NN ,_, the_DT Rye-mother_JJ or_CC the_DT
Pea-mother_JJ ,_, and_CC children_NNS are_VBP warned_VBN against_IN straying_VBG in_IN the_DT rye_NN or_CC
among_IN the_DT peas_NNS by_IN threats_NNS of_IN the_DT Rye-mother_JJ or_CC the_DT Pea-mother_JJ ._. Again_RB
the_DT Corn-mother_NN is_VBZ believed_VBN to_TO make_VB the_DT crop_NN grow_VB ._. Thus_RB in_IN the_DT
neighbourhood_NN of_IN Magdeburg_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ sometimes_RB said_VBN ,_, "_`` It_PRP will_MD be_VB a_DT good_JJ
year_NN for_IN flax_NN ;_: the_DT Flax-mother_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN seen_VBN ."_RP In_IN a_DT village_NN of_IN
Styria_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ said_VBD that_IN the_DT Corn-mother_JJ ,_, in_IN the_DT shape_NN of_IN a_DT female_NN
puppet_NN made_VBD out_IN of_IN the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN of_IN corn_NN and_CC dressed_VBN in_IN white_JJ ,_, may_MD
be_VB seen_VBN at_IN mid-night_NN in_IN the_DT corn-fields_NNS ,_, which_WDT she_PRP fertilises_VBZ by_IN
passing_VBG through_IN them_PRP ;_: but_CC if_IN she_PRP is_VBZ angry_JJ with_IN a_DT farmer_NN ,_, she_PRP withers_WRB
up_IN all_DT his_PRP$ corn_NN ._.

Further_RB ,_, the_DT Corn-mother_NN plays_VBZ an_DT important_JJ part_NN in_IN harvest_NN customs_NNS ._.
She_PRP is_VBZ believed_VBN to_TO be_VB present_JJ in_IN the_DT handful_NN of_IN corn_NN which_WDT is_VBZ left_VBN
standing_VBG last_JJ on_IN the_DT field_NN ;_: and_CC with_IN the_DT cutting_NN of_IN this_DT last_JJ
handful_NN she_PRP is_VBZ caught_VBN ,_, or_CC driven_VBN away_RB ,_, or_CC killed_VBN ._. In_IN the_DT first_JJ of_IN
these_DT cases_NNS ,_, the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN is_VBZ carried_VBN joyfully_RB home_NN and_CC honoured_VBD as_IN
a_DT divine_JJ being_NN ._. It_PRP is_VBZ placed_VBN in_IN the_DT barn_NN ,_, and_CC at_IN threshing_VBG the_DT
corn-spirit_NN appears_VBZ again_RB ._. In_IN the_DT Hanoverian_NNP district_NN of_IN Hadeln_NNP the_DT
reapers_NNS stand_VBP round_IN the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN and_CC beat_VBD it_PRP with_IN sticks_NNS in_IN order_NN
to_TO drive_VB the_DT Corn-mother_JJ out_IN of_IN it_PRP ._. They_PRP call_VBP to_TO each_DT other_JJ ,_, "_'' There_EX
she_PRP is_VBZ !_. hit_VB her_PRP !_. Take_VB care_VB she_PRP doesn_RP '_POS t_NN catch_NN you_PRP !"_VBD The_DT beating_NN goes_VBZ
on_IN till_IN the_DT grain_NN is_VBZ completely_RB threshed_VBN out_RP ;_: then_RB the_DT Corn-mother_NN
is_VBZ believed_VBN to_TO be_VB driven_VBN away_RB ._. In_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN Danzig_NNP the_DT
person_NN who_WP cuts_VBZ the_DT last_JJ ears_NNS of_IN corn_NN makes_VBZ them_PRP into_IN a_DT doll_NN ,_, which_WDT
is_VBZ called_VBN the_DT Corn-mother_NN or_CC the_DT Old_NNP Woman_NNP and_CC is_VBZ brought_VBN home_NN on_IN
the_DT last_JJ waggon_NN ._. In_IN some_DT parts_NNS of_IN Holstein_NNP the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN is_VBZ dressed_VBN
in_IN woman_NN '_'' s_PRP clothes_NNS and_CC called_VBD the_DT Corn-mother_NN ._. It_PRP is_VBZ carried_VBN home_NN on_IN
the_DT last_JJ waggon_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB thoroughly_RB drenched_VBN with_IN water_NN ._. The_DT
drenching_NN with_IN water_NN is_VBZ doubtless_RB a_DT rain-charm_NN ._. In_IN the_DT district_NN of_IN
Bruck_NNP in_IN Styria_NNP the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN ,_, called_VBD the_DT Corn-mother_NNP ,_, is_VBZ made_VBN up_IN

are_VBP plucked_VBN out_IN of_IN it_PRP and_CC made_VBD into_IN a_DT wreath_NN ,_, which_WDT ,_, twined_VBN with_IN

threshing_NN is_VBZ over_RB ._. The_DT man_NN who_WP gives_VBZ the_DT last_JJ stroke_NN at_IN threshing_NN is_VBZ

church_NN on_IN the_DT following_VBG Sunday_NNP ;_: and_CC on_IN Easter_NNP Eve_NNP the_DT grain_NN is_VBZ
rubbed_VBD out_IN of_IN it_PRP by_IN a_DT seven-year_JJ -_: old_JJ girl_NN and_CC scattered_VBN amongst_IN the_DT
young_JJ corn_NN ._. At_IN Christmas_NNP the_DT straw_NN of_IN the_DT wreath_NN is_VBZ placed_VBN in_IN the_DT
manger_NN to_TO make_VB the_DT cattle_NNS thrive_VBP ._. Here_RB the_DT fertilising_NN power_NN of_IN the_DT
Corn-mother_NN is_VBZ plainly_RB brought_VBN out_RP by_IN scattering_VBG the_DT seed_NN taken_VBN from_IN
her_PRP$ body_NN (_-LRB- for_IN the_DT wreath_NN is_VBZ made_VBN out_IN of_IN the_DT Corn-mother_JJ )_-RRB- among_IN the_DT
new_JJ corn_NN ;_: and_CC her_PRP$ influence_NN over_IN animal_NN life_NN is_VBZ indicated_VBN by_IN placing_VBG
the_DT straw_NN in_IN the_DT manger_NN ._. Amongst_IN the_DT Slavs_NNP also_RB the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN is_VBZ
known_VBN as_IN the_DT Rye-mother_NN ,_, the_DT Wheat-mother_JJ ,_, the_DT Oats-mother_NN ,_, the_DT
Barley-mother_NNP ,_, and_CC so_RB on_IN ,_, according_VBG to_TO the_DT crop_NN ._. In_IN the_DT district_NN of_IN

is_VBZ a_DT bit_NN of_IN schoolmaster_NN '_'' s_PRP learning_VBG ._. In_IN Upper_NNP Brittany_NNP the_DT last_JJ

Sometimes_RB the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN is_VBZ called_VBN ,_, not_RB the_DT Corn-mother_JJ ,_, but_CC the_DT

Sometimes_RB again_RB the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN is_VBZ called_VBN the_DT Grandmother_NNP ,_, and_CC is_VBZ

Often_RB the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN is_VBZ called_VBN the_DT Old_NNP Woman_NNP or_CC the_DT Old_NNP Man_NN ._. In_IN
Germany_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ frequently_RB shaped_VBN and_CC dressed_VBN as_IN a_DT woman_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT

"_`` has_VBZ the_DT Old_NNP Woman_NNP ."_VBD When_WRB the_DT sheaves_NNS are_VBP being_VBG set_VBN up_RP in_IN heaps_NNS ,_, the_DT
person_NN who_WP gets_VBZ hold_NN of_IN the_DT Old_NNP Woman_NNP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT largest_JJS and_CC
thickest_JJS of_IN all_PDT the_DT sheaves_NNS ,_, is_VBZ jeered_VBN at_IN by_IN the_DT rest_NN ,_, who_WP call_VBP out_IN
to_TO him_PRP ,_, "_`` He_PRP has_VBZ the_DT Old_NNP Woman_NNP and_CC must_MD keep_VB her_PRP ."_IN The_DT woman_NN who_WP
binds_NNS the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN is_VBZ sometimes_RB herself_PRP called_VBD the_DT Old_NNP Woman_NNP ,_, and_CC
it_PRP is_VBZ said_VBD that_IN she_PRP will_MD be_VB married_VBN in_IN the_DT next_JJ year_NN ._. In_IN Neusaass_NNP ,_,
West_NNP Prussia_NNP ,_, both_CC the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN --_: which_WDT is_VBZ dressed_VBN up_RP in_IN jacket_NN ,_,
hat_NN ,_, and_CC ribbons_NNS --_: and_CC the_DT woman_NN who_WP binds_VBZ it_PRP are_VBP called_VBN the_DT Old_NNP
Woman_NN ._. Together_RB they_PRP are_VBP brought_VBN home_NN on_IN the_DT last_JJ waggon_NN and_CC are_VBP
drenched_VBN with_IN water_NN ._. In_IN various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN North_NNP Germany_NNP the_DT last_JJ
sheaf_NN at_IN harvest_NN is_VBZ made_VBN up_RP into_IN a_DT human_JJ effigy_NN and_CC called_VBD "_`` the_DT Old_NNP
Man_NN ";_NN and_CC the_DT woman_NN who_WP bound_VBD it_PRP is_VBZ said_VBD "_`` to_TO have_VB the_DT Old_NNP Man_NN ."_NN

In_IN West_NNP Prussia_NNP ,_, when_WRB the_DT last_JJ rye_NN is_VBZ being_VBG raked_VBN together_RB ,_, the_DT
women_NNS and_CC girls_NNS hurry_VBP with_IN the_DT work_NN ,_, for_IN none_NN of_IN them_PRP likes_VBZ to_TO be_VB

last_JJ sheaf_NN ,_, which_WDT must_MD be_VB carried_VBN before_IN the_DT other_JJ reapers_NNS by_IN the_DT

it_PRP is_VBZ made_VBN unusually_RB large_JJ and_CC is_VBZ sometimes_RB weighted_VBN with_IN a_DT stone_NN ._.
Among_IN the_DT Wends_NNP the_DT man_NN or_CC woman_NN who_WP binds_VBZ the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN at_IN wheat_NN

the_DT farmhouse_NN and_CC remains_VBZ till_IN a_DT new_JJ Old_NNP Man_NN is_VBZ made_VBN at_IN the_DT next_JJ

In_IN some_DT of_IN these_DT customs_NNS ,_, as_IN Mannhardt_NNP has_VBZ remarked_VBN ,_, the_DT person_NN who_WP
is_VBZ called_VBN by_IN the_DT same_JJ name_NN as_IN the_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN and_CC sits_VBZ beside_IN it_PRP on_IN

The_DT last_JJ sheaf_NN ,_, designated_VBN as_IN the_DT Old_NNP Woman_NNP ,_, is_VBZ often_RB distinguished_VBN

In_IN Scotland_NNP ,_, when_WRB the_DT last_JJ corn_NN was_VBD cut_VBN after_IN Hallowmas_NNP ,_, the_DT female_NN

remained_VBD with_IN had_VBD '_'' the_DT old_JJ woman_NN '_'' to_TO keep_VB for_IN that_DT year_NN ."_.

In_IN the_DT island_NN of_IN Islay_NNP the_DT last_JJ corn_NN cut_NN goes_VBZ by_IN the_DT name_NN of_IN the_DT Old_NNP

the_DT proper_JJ end_NN of_IN the_DT Old_NNP Wife_NNP ._.

Usages_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ sort_NN are_VBP reported_VBN from_IN Wales_NNP ._. Thus_RB in_IN North_NNP
Pembrokeshire_NNP a_DT tuft_NN of_IN the_DT last_JJ corn_NN cut_NN ,_, from_IN six_CD to_TO twelve_CD inches_NNS
long_JJ ,_, is_VBZ plaited_VBN and_CC goes_VBZ by_IN the_DT name_NN of_IN the_DT Hag_NNP (_-LRB- wrach_NN );_NN and_CC
quaint_JJ old_JJ customs_NNS used_VBD to_TO be_VB practised_VBN with_IN it_PRP within_IN the_DT memory_NN of_IN
many_JJ persons_NNS still_RB alive_JJ ._. Great_NNP was_VBD the_DT excitement_NN among_IN the_DT reapers_NNS

their_PRP$ sickles_NNS at_IN it_PRP ,_, and_CC the_DT one_NN who_WP succeeded_VBD in_IN cutting_VBG it_PRP
received_VBD a_DT jug_NN of_IN home-brewed_JJ ale_NN ._. The_DT Hag_NNP (_-LRB- wrach_NN )_-RRB- was_VBD then_RB
hurriedly_RB made_VBD and_CC taken_VBN to_TO a_DT neighbouring_NN farm_NN ,_, where_WRB the_DT reapers_NNS
